Hi, Zub. I’ve got some business for you.
People only ever come to me on business, nobody invites me over for tea.

You’ll manage without tea... I know that recently one stalker was planning to sell you some papers concerning the operation of the system for pumping water out of tunnels connecting various facilities deep underground. I need to take a look at a few things in them.

Just like that, straight to the point? No easing into it, no asking how my health is, no telling me how you’re doing, no mentioning how you happen to know who was going to sell me what. Though it’s not hard to guess. Docent tipped you off, right? You don’t have to answer, no need to be Sherlock Holmes here.\nAs for the papers… they’re already gone, used to start a campfire. Don’t worry though, everything interesting was copied and rewritten onto other media.
Who would doubt it. I’d like to get acquainted with that knowledge. Care to bargain?

That depends on what exactly you need. Information comes in all kinds: important, very important, vitally necessary. And the price, naturally, will differ. Be specific about what interests you, and I’ll assess the level of importance. Then we’ll decide whether there’s even any point in bargaining, yeah?

Basically, the topic is this: there’s a flooded tunnel, and there are pumps that can be used to drain it. I want to know exactly where that tunnel is, how to get into it, and how the water can be pumped out.

And that’s all? What about the motive? You expect me to believe you dragged yourself all the way here and are ready to pay out of sheer curiosity? Or are you hinting that Zub’s gotten a bit dull?\nWhere does that little tunnel lead?
I’m saying there’s a commodity, there’s a seller, there’s a buyer — everything else doesn’t matter.

You’d be safe to take on a recon mission, Marked One. Solid as a rock. Not a single extra word slips out, huh? Admirable, on the one hand, but on the other… you could’ve been a bit more forthcoming. In exchange for a discount, for example. Ah well, we’ll see.\nAnyway, come back in about half an hour. I need to check my notes and have a word with a couple of people. So take a walk.
Uh-huh. I’ll be back soon.
What’s the situation with our tunnel business?
You showed up too early. I’m waiting for one message. Once I get it, we’ll talk.

You’re just in time. So, here’s how it is: I’ve got the code for the door to the flooded tunnel you’re so eager to get into. You do know it’s locked with a keypad, right? That’s one. There’s information on where power is supplied to the pumps. That’s two. And I also roughly know the place where they’re switched on. Where do we start?
With the price. Is it approximate too? Or exact?
For the door code — a dummy artifact. For pointing out the power supply location — a couple of dummy artifacts, or we can haggle.
And what do you want for the tip on where to switch on the pumps?
That’s a separate conversation. Artifacts won’t be enough here. But we’ll get to that later.
Got it. Give me a moment, I’ll size up my options so I know what I can bargain with.
So where does the power to the pumps get supplied from?
And did you bring the payment?
Remind me, what was it you needed again...
Two Dummies.
You said we could haggle a bit—so let's do it!
Alright, let's. I take it all this is important and urgent for you. I'm ready to knock off one Dummy if you find me a part for a scanner.
What?! What scanner now?

An ordinary one! What backwater are you from anyway? It's the 21st century out there. You think I copy all the documents by hand? Some things have to be scanned. And some damn thing in it burned out. Docent took a look, called it something or other, I don't remember. Mikhailych could help get the part, but he won't promise anything sooner than two weeks.
Oh! So that's how it is. Means you need it urgently too. Then knock the price down some more.

Fine, you convinced me. Get the scanner spare part and we'll call it even.\nI think you should ask the nerds, preferably the ones at the Swamps. Their base is new in the Zone, their equipment is modern. Hopefully they haven't sold or drunk it all away yet.
The Swamps?! Nah, I won't be looking for your part. Time's not waiting. I think I had some Dummies somewhere, just need to dig them out.
Scribble the model on a sheet, or whatever it is. I'll look for the part or try to find two Dummies.
Then it's settled. Just keep in mind, Tooth won't wait forever.
Let's talk about the door code.
Got the payment ready?
I just remembered... I've got one clever little gadget, so the code doesn't interest me anymore. Let's drop it.
Brought a Dummy. I'm listening.
Not yet. Thought maybe your conscience had gotten the better of you.
Suit yourself. Your gadget might jam. But hey, owner knows best, as they say.
The right decision. Write down the code: 922758.
I traded my conscience for chewing gum back in school.
Great, that's settled then.
For some reason, I believe you.
I'm here about the payment.
Did you bring everything?
Take your Dummies.
I found your part, packed up in a box.
Just checking, thought maybe you'd changed your mind.
Excellent. I knew you'd get it all done.
Knew it, huh... Alright, about the pump hookup. What is it?

Here's the thing... There were no exact instructions in those papers. All that's known is that power can be supplied from another underground complex, where nerds used to live. It's somewhere in the Dark Valley, but I guarantee it's not X-18. As for any other underground sites there, I don't know. You?
I know, I know. You trying to squeeze info out of me on top of the payment I already gave you or what? Go on.
That's all, Marked One. Besides, you got what I'm talking about, right?
What do you mean, "that's all"?! And where are the pumps started? There too?
No, somewhere else... But from this point on, we move on to the main thing.\nWord reached me that you met the Monolithians on Radar.
What do those frostbitten lunatics have to do with the pumps?

No idea yet, maybe they do. Someone flooded that tunnel, after all. Huh?\nYou heard anything about their weapons? They say the stuff crumbles to dust the moment you pick it up. They also say someone wants to find a way around that... What's got you thinking?
Just turning thoughts over in my head, figuring out where you're going with this. Whether I should tell you to get lost right away, or hear you out.

Hear me out, it gets more interesting.\nThere's a group of people who've almost found such a way. They got some equipment, or a device, or a tool... bottom line, an object that in theory can slow down the decay process, or even freeze it entirely. And now all they need is the weapon itself.
Let them go to the Monolithians and politely ask for it.

Don't get smart, Marked One. The whole trick is that the tool seems to exist, and the weapon can supposedly be found too, but no one can actually pick it up.\nI don't know who put this idea in their heads, but now they're looking for a man with a tattoo like yours. For some reason, they decided that people like that have a chance of handling Monolithian weapons. You could play that angle, and at the same time check whether it's all true. Aren't you curious to find out why you're so “special”?
You hinting that I'm akin to the Monolithians? Hm... So what's in it for you in all this? I know you won't lift a finger unless there's something in it for you.

Long story short, there are interested parties—let's call them competitors to the group looking for a way to take Monolithian weapons out of the Zone. Consider me a representative of this competing organization. They want solid proof that the tool exists—or whatever you want to call it—and that it really does allow someone to handle the weapon. And if that's the case, they'll enter the game themselves.

You really spun a tale there, Tooth. Sounds like a full-blown spy thriller.\nI do know that some mercs are looking for me, and I know where their base is at the Army Warehouses. It's very possible they're after me for exactly the reason you mentioned. But what then? You're suggesting I go to them, borrow the tool, then find a Monolithian weapon and try to pick it up? Bold plan!

Don't play dumb, Marked One. As far as I know, you're the only one in the whole Zone with such a mark. I heard there were others once... there were, but they're all gone. So you have a certain privileged status and can use it. You won't be able to dictate terms to these people, of course, but haggling is very much an option. For starters, just go there, talk to them, find out their plans. They’re unlikely to start twisting your arms right away—they won’t expect you to show up on your own. Once you get the lay of the land, come back to me.

You've got everything running smooth as silk... but there is sense in what you're saying. And I myself can't get any peace over this strange connection of mine to the Monolith and this mark on my hand... But that no longer concerns you.

I don't need your secrets. I've got enough of my own. Bottom line—head straight to the Warehouses, to the merc camp. From time to time, a certain man shows up there looking for you. Though you probably already know that. And I'll be waiting for results.
Why didn't you say all this right away? You really dragged it out...

If I'd told you right away, you might've refused. I needed to see how badly you wanted to drain that tunnel. This way, you've already invested in it, got half of what you wanted—would be stupid to turn back now.
Found out something about the tool.
Spill it.
I met one “stitcher” at the Army Warehouses. According to him, the tool definitely exists, and it’s meant exclusively for the weapons the Monolithians wield. The guy made that absolutely clear to me.
So I’m supposed to pass your honest scout’s oath on to the client? And what, after that talk they just let you go, no strings attached?

Let me go… for now. They need me, you know that yourself. They’ll be waiting for me on Radar, near the entrance to the old lab. I’m supposed to come and show them where in that lab I saw a Monolithian gun… there was a story, not important now. In theory, it should still be there. Most likely, they’ll hand me those very tools so I can try to pick the weapon up. And if I do what they want, then there really won’t be any options left. I don’t think they’ll let me out of there alive.
I don’t get them… Has it even crossed anyone’s mind that you might just not go there?

They need me to come of my own free will. Nobody knows what kind of technology it is, why the weapon falls apart, what it depends on. Could be body temperature, could be smell, could be your emotions, or even your intent—the desire to take it in your hands. Hell knows. Either way, this is a real chance for me to find out whether I really do have some kind of “kinship” with the Monolithians… and if so, I need to understand what that gives me.
Yeah… there’s definitely something in you, no doubt about it. Aren’t you afraid you’ll end up like them yourself before long? Sitting all day, rocking your head, mumbling something under your breath…

Afraid or not—what difference does it make? Trying to motivate me some more? Don’t bother. I can feel that one way or another I’ll have to crawl into that lab. If I don’t go willingly, they’ll drag me in on a rope, like a cow to the slaughterhouse. They won’t let me slip away anymore—I keep catching the looks of some shady types on me. They’re waiting for me to ripen, but they won’t wait long.
And that lab has only one entrance? A structure like that isn’t some potato cellar. Evacuation routes should be thought out. Can’t you somehow… well, you know.

That’s exactly what I’m counting on… I’m not a fool, not about to stick my own neck in a noose. But I’m not sure I’ll find the exit again. Not sure at all. And there’s no point leading them to another entrance either—then they’ll surely set up cordons at both. And without the tool, there’s no way either…
Bottom line, Marked One, I’m not asking for much. Just show me that tool at least, so I can be sure. I can’t just pass on your assurances. My reputation matters to me too.
No promises, I haven’t even seen it with my own eyes yet. Anyway, if it works out, we’ll see each other again; if not—don’t hold it against me.
Well then, shake on it and farewell. You should lay out a spread for your buddies before the road. If you’re heading out, do it proper. So they remember you. Heh-heh…

Funny guy… I don’t have any buddies. Though… it might be worth dropping by the Doctor one last time. He didn’t abandon me when I was in trouble and took care of me as best he could. And there are a couple of things I still want to ask him. If I’m saying goodbye to anyone, it’s only him. Too early to think about that, but who knows how it’ll all turn out…
There are no late arrivals when visiting God. Always early, but never too late.
Pakhom, you’re the quartermaster. You must have everything.
Everything or not, but I do have some things.
I need a scanner part, for the “Epson...” model. Can you help?
Hm. I do have such a scanner, and spare parts for it too... You really need it?
Honestly, very much.
No need to say it. I can already see it—you’re fussing, sweating, hands shaking... Did you leave anything for preservation? I mean monster stuff.
I did, we can take a look.
Don’t worry, we’ll take a look. You hand over a preserved monster part to us for scientific purposes, and I give you the scanner part. Deal?
No objections. Especially since I won’t need them anymore.
No, but tell me what you need. We’ll do it.

“We’ll do it,” he says. If you haven’t left anything worthwhile in our stores so far, when exactly are you going to do it now? Wait for you? We’ll have to shake down other stalkers, see who left us what.
What if I have something fresh? Won’t that work?

Our assistants need a part that’s been lying in that preservative for a long time. They discovered that the cells under that preservative started to... well... rege—break your tongue saying it. Rejuvenating—there! Anyway, it has to be preserved monster stuff. Fresh won’t do.
You’d better be careful with science, or you might end up like that—“splash into the cauldron and boiled there.”
About the scanner part?
Marked One, we already talked it over. What kind of monster stuff do you have?
A controller’s hand.
A pseudogiant’s paw.
A poltergeist’s eye.
An electrochimera’s kidney.
I changed my mind. Science can do without it.
Yeah, that’s just what’s needed. A scanner part is a fragile thing, so I packed it in a box. It’s bulky, but light.
Thanks, Pakhom, you really helped me out. And... uh... goodbye.
Who are you, and what do you want?
Hi. I’m the Marked One. Just passing through on business. Don’t think I’ve seen you here before, so I figured I’d say hello.
Hi. You the boss around here? Heard someone was looking for me. I’m the Marked One. And I’ve got the tattoo on my arm, see.
Ah! Came on your own. So this is what you’re like, Marked One. Well, have a seat, let’s talk.
Thanks, I’ll stand. I won’t be long.
That depends. The talk could be quick, or you might end up staying here for good.
Let’s not start with threats, old man. Judging by how you reacted to me showing up, you need something from me. I’d like to know what exactly.

Let’s not start with threats, old man. You didn’t look for a man with a tattoo like this just to bury him in the nearest bushes, did you? You need something from me, and I’d like to know what exactly.

Right to the point? Fine. I’m a straightforward man too, Marked One, so I’ll say it as it is. There are two options on the table: either we don’t waste time and stitch you up right here and now, or we squeeze the information out of you first and stitch you up after.
I already told you—cut the scare tactics. I’m used to it. Maybe you’ll finally get to the point?
You think I’m bluffing? You’re wrong. But fine... For starters, tell me who you are.
I’m the Marked One. Just a regular stalker, that’s all. You, on the other hand, haven’t introduced yourself.
Regular, huh... You know, it’s not every day that special orders come down on regular stalkers, with this kind of fuss over finding them.
You’d know better. So what’s the reason for all this fuss, as you put it?

The request for you didn’t come from some local police department, get my drift? It came from a very influential... structure, let’s call it that. And as soon as it was taken up, you vanished like you’d sunk into water. Turned out you’d headed toward Pripyat, and after that—no traces. Anywhere. We figured that was it, finished material. And then you show up. Been at the Bar, been at Yantar... And now—there you are, showed up here yourself. So where have you been hiding, Marked One?

I was sick. Caught a bad cold, pneumonia, laid low for a while... Got a bit better and showed up. Thanks, of course, for your “structure” being so concerned about me, but if that’s all you wanted to say, I’ll be on my way.
A joker, huh? That’s fine, we’ll knock that nonsense out of you fast enough. I need to send a message to someone, so go take a walk for about fifteen minutes.
Going to ask for instructions? So you’re not the boss after all... And what, you’re just letting me go like that? What if I get sick again, and this time—for a very long while?
Don’t worry, we’ll “cure” you real quick. And where are you going to go now, with a mug as recognizable as yours? You’ll be easy to track anywhere—you won’t get lost.
Alright. Go confer, and I’ll come back later.
What now? I told you—go take a walk for now.
You writing a poem over there or something? Alright, alright, I’m going.
Yeah, you’re just in time, Marked One. I was already about to send my boys after you.
No need to send the boys right away. You could’ve just dropped me a message on the PDA if you were waiting that badly. So, what did the boss say?

If I were you, I wouldn’t be so eager to know too much. Let’s talk business.\nAccording to Wolfhound, you, Marked One, likely possess some kind of unusual ability. Wolfhound was way too soft with you—clearly thought you’d open up on your own and spill everything. Should’ve squeezed you harder right away and beaten the information out of you.
I wouldn’t say Wolfhound was exactly coddling me. And I don’t have any special abilities to speak of.

Don’t play dumb like you don’t get what this is about. Wolfhound blabbed plenty to you: about the special weapon, about how it can’t just be taken out of the Zone, and about the Monolithians who were looking for a man with a tattoo like yours.
Yeah, that did come up... By the way, where is Wolfhound himself?
Far away. Very far. But don’t dodge the subject.

Right, we did talk about the Monolithians and their special weapon. Supposedly you can’t take it—it falls apart right in your hands or something like that. I thought he was just spinning a yarn. So that kind of weapon really exists? There must be some special device or tool needed, if you can’t take it by hand...

I see you know more than you should. Who told you about the tool? You figured out right that we need you alive, so we won’t kill you. At least not right now. But, say, trimming down the number of fingers on your hands if you keep playing the fool—that’s easy enough. So spill everything. Last time I’m asking nicely.

Wait, wait, commander... Easy. One guy—I ran into him by chance once in Limansk—said while drunk that some scientist had lost a tool for a Monolith gun. I figured it was just another drunken rant. He was talking about a tool, but I didn’t get what kind of gun it was. Thought “Monolith” meant something big. And now you reminded me of my talk with Wolfhound about a weapon that shoots electric fire, and that drunken chatter popped back into my head... so I put two and two together. But the tool itself...

Easy now, don’t get worked up... I think I remember—I had a talk with some... scientist. He mentioned something about special weapons and special tools. Seemed like someone was actively searching for them around the Zone. I didn’t think much of it back then. You never know who’s got what problems. And now you reminded me of my talk with Wolfhound about a weapon that shoots electric fire, and that chatter popped back into my head... so I put two and two together. But the tool itself...

No one told me anything about a tool, cross my heart! Maybe there is no such thing... I just figured that if there’s such a unique gun that spits electric fire, then you’d only be able to take it with some special device, since otherwise it crumbles to dust right away!

Aha! Scared stiff, tongue loosens right up and you stop thinking things through properly, huh? I never told you the weapon shoots fire. And Wolfhound couldn’t have known that, let alone your drunk. That only became known when the path to the north opened up. Which means you’ve seen the weapon in action! Where? When?

Aha! Scared stiff, tongue loosens right up and you stop thinking things through properly, huh? I never told you the weapon shoots fire. And Wolfhound couldn’t have known that, and neither could your scientist. That only became known when the path to the north opened up. Which means you’ve seen the weapon in action! Where? When?

Aha! Scared stiff, tongue loosens right up and you stop thinking things through properly, huh? I never told you the weapon shoots fire. And Wolfhound couldn’t have known that. No one could. That only became known when the path to the north opened up. Which means you’ve seen the weapon in action! Where? When?

If I were you, I wouldn’t be so eager to know too much. Let’s talk business. I’ll warn you right away: I don’t have time to mess around with you or coax you into telling everything nicely. But I do have this syringe. You know what a “truth serum” is? I can tell by your eyes that you do. One shot—and you’ll spill everything. I’m only afraid this drug has an unpleasant side effect—the chances of ending up a complete idiot for life are pretty high.
So... decided to lead with your trump cards right away, huh? Consider me impressed. What do you want to know?

You know about the Monolithians, right? Lately they’ve got new guns—unusual ones. Accuracy almost one hundred percent, stopping power—don’t even get me started! Some corporations abroad would really love to “ride the wave” and outdo their competitors in supplying this kind of weaponry. But here’s the paradox—the gun exists, it kills just fine, but you can’t take it! Not even with any kind of grabbers. You try to pick it up and—poof—nothing but black smoke. So we’re looking for at least some kind of lead that would let us take such weapons out of the Zone and, so to speak, take them apart. Figure out the principle.
Very interesting story. Can’t say I’ve heard anything like that among stalkers.

Interrupt me with your jokes one more time and we’ll see if you keep joking after a shot of that “serum.”\nNow, where was I?! Ah... There’s information that the Monolithians were looking for you. Well, maybe not you personally, but someone with a mark on his arm like yours. And we know for sure that you met with them. What did you talk about? Did you see any unusual weapons?

Nothing special... mostly listened to their philosophical ramblings. Not many Monolithians can even speak normally, and the ones who can would be better off keeping quiet. You’ll break your brain trying to figure out what they’re on about. As for weapons... no, I didn’t see anything like that.
Didn’t see any, huh? Think again. And think hard. This is your last chance. After that comes the jab.

Ah! Just remembered something... One guy—I ran into him by chance once in Limansk—said while drunk that some scientist had lost a tool for a Monolith gun. I thought it was just another drunken rant. He was talking about a tool, but I didn’t understand what kind of gun it was. Figured “Monolith” meant something big. And then you started talking about a weapon that shoots electric fire, and that drunken chatter popped back into my head... so I put two and two together. But the weapon itself...

Ah! I remember now—I had a conversation with some... scientist. He mentioned something about special weapons and special tools. Seems like someone is actively searching for them around the Zone. I didn’t pay much attention back then. You never know who’s got what problems. And then you started talking about a weapon that shoots electric fire, and that chatter popped back into my head... so I put two and two together. But the weapon itself...
Cross my heart, I didn’t see anything... Do you really think I wouldn’t notice some unusual monstrosity spitting electric fire?

Aha! Fear loosens the tongue right away and you stop thinking every move through, huh? I never told you the weapon shoots fire. And your drunk couldn’t have known that. That only became known when the path to the north opened up. Which means you’ve seen the weapon in action! Where? When?

Aha! Fear loosens the tongue right away and you stop thinking every move through, huh? I never told you the weapon shoots fire. And your scientist couldn’t have known that. That only became known when the path to the north opened up. Which means you’ve seen the weapon in action! Where? When?

Aha! Fear loosens the tongue right away and you stop thinking every move through, huh? I never told you the weapon shoots fire. And no one could have told you that. That only became known when the path to the north opened up. Which means you’ve seen the weapon in action! Where? When?

Damn it... I screwed up! Yes, I did see such a weapon. By accident. I got a tip about an artifact stash, so I climbed into one lab on Radar. And there was some green freak sitting there. I got lucky and took him down first. He vanished right away, only the gun was left behind. I pick it up—and it slips out, pick it up again—it slips out again. Tried a few times, and it just keeps slipping away. I spat on it then, decided I’d try to find out later from people smarter than me how you’re supposed to take that weapon, and then come back for it. But somehow I never got around to it. Swear to God, that’s exactly how it was. I don’t know anything else.
So you’re saying the weapon is still there?
Well, probably... Where else would it go, if you can’t pick it up?!

Didn’t you understand from everything you were told that the weapon falls apart immediately, at the very first contact with a human? Yet you claim you picked it up several times and it remained intact... So either you’re lying about having seen the weapon, or we didn’t waste all that effort looking for you for nothing. And we’re going to check that.
You’ll hand over the Monolithians’ weapon to me? Oh, right! It falls apart. So that means I’ll get the tools?

That’s not for me to decide, but I think so. At worst, to confirm your story, you’ll show our people how you take the gun with your bare hands. And then we’ll see.\nSo here’s how it is! We’ve known about the underground facilities on Radar for a long time, we just didn’t bother trying to get in before. But the emission is gone, and the situation has changed. We’ll send a couple of our groups to Radar to control the approaches to the bunkers, so no one gets in there and grabs the weapon out of stupidity ahead of time. We might even seal the doors. We’ll take a look around inside ourselves for now, and you’ll come later, when I send for you. You’ll show us where you saw the weapon, if we don’t find it ourselves. Then you’ll try to put it into a special container, and after that—we’ll play it by ear.
Actually, I’ve got other things to do...

Marked One, don’t start again! If you won’t come willingly, we’ll make you—we’ll bring you by force. But for now I’m asking politely. Because it’s preferable that you yourself want to come and yourself want to take that weapon. Who knows, maybe whether it rejects you or not depends on your intent. Everything has to be taken into account here. Assuming, of course, that all this is true...
Alright, alright. I get it—I’ve got nowhere to run from you. I’ll wait for the call.
You still alive and nobody’s stitched you up yet?
Who the hell needs me?!
You’re still wandering around... Didn’t you get the message that they’ve been waiting for you on Radar? Move it!
I’m going, I’m going... Bossy, aren’t you.
Doctor...
Ah, Marked One, decided to visit me again?
I came to say goodbye, sort of. We might not see each other again.
You’re rushing north again? Something still calling you?
Yes, but I won’t go where I’ve already been, I don’t see the point. I think I can get through by a different route, one Strelok didn’t take.

So you still want to find Strelok? You’ve understood who you are, come to terms with yourself. And everything else... Even if we imagine for a second that you meet Strelok, it’s unlikely he’ll tell you more than you already know about his exploits in the Zone and about the Zone itself.
To hell with him and his exploits! I don’t need Strelok. I want to get to the Monolith itself...
Why? Want to check if what they say about wish-granting is true? I think it’s just a myth.

Well, Strelok himself had a different opinion on that. And his notes won’t let me rest either... There’s something else.\nOne of the local brainiacs shared an interesting theory about an information field. All the information of this world is stored somewhere, in some kind of sphere. And the Monolith is like a terminal for accessing that storage.
The noosphere theory? Yes, I’m familiar with it. But there’s nothing about the Monolith in it.

That was his assumption. Whoever makes contact with this terminal could obtain knowledge about practically anything... And I still have questions coming out of my ears. What let me through to the center? Why did it lure me and not kill me, but send me back? Why is it luring me again? Why do the Monolithians treat me so loyally, almost accept me as an equal? They even tasked me with “planting seeds” in the “Matrices”? And those green creatures that were shooting at me—who are they?\nThis damned Monolith both draws me in and doesn’t accept me, and having rejected me, draws me in again... Ah, forget it.
You’re talking about the Monolith as if it were some living being. And why did you take those notes seriously? Why do you think they have anything to do with you?

It’s all about the Monolith weapon. You don’t know... I saw their special weapon. For all ordinary people who held it in their hands, it fell apart. But with me, it didn’t. Yes, I couldn’t take it—it was like it slipped out of my hands by itself—but it didn’t fall apart. It’s the same as with the Monolith—it wants to give, and yet it doesn’t. Why? So there’s something in me? I have to find out. The mercenaries are looking for that weapon now, I told them where I saw it. For some reason they desperately need it. And what I need from them are... special tools, to test my guesses... But that’s beside the point. Bottom line, I’m not sure I’ll come back from there...
You don’t have to go to them. And you don’t have to go north. Just throw it all out of your head and live your life.
I can’t not go anymore. And it’s better for me to come on my own, so I have at least some freedom to maneuver, than to be dragged there by force and given no choice at all.
Alright. You deal with the mercenaries, get from them what you need, reach the Monolith itself. What will you do there?

I don’t know for sure yet—it’ll be clear on the spot. I’ve thought about all this for a long time, but only now have the pieces of the puzzle finally started to come together. And here’s the version that seems most plausible to me. Whether I ended up in the Thicket by accident during Strelok’s experiment or he arranged it deliberately—it doesn’t really matter. He quickly figured out that the very person he’d been searching for so long and so unsuccessfully had literally fallen into his lap—a man with the Monolith’s psychocode implanted in his consciousness. One whom the Monolith does not perceive as an enemy, and therefore can let come close.
Listen, Marked One, you’re not...

Let me finish, don’t interrupt.\nStrelok decided to hedge his bets. If he himself couldn’t break through to the Monolith, a backup player had to take the field. I’m somehow connected to the Monolith, and it may well be that this connection is two-way. Which means that if I manage to “reach out” to it, I can just as well try to “implant” a fragment of the human element into its essence. How? Hell if I know... Even by making a wish, as the legend says. Asking for power, for example, or immortality—what’s the difference?! I think the plan is very much in Strelok’s spirit. What do you think?
Well, you know... In my opinion, you need some rest.

We only dream of peace.\nYeah... What a sly type that Strelok is. He told the three of you to take care of me. He fooled Ghost, wrapping my persona in mystery. So much so that even the utterly unprincipled Ghost was, until recently, forced to keep an eye on me, albeit from a distance, instead of starting to beat everything he knew out of me. And the notes he left to Ivar... I’d bet my life there was far more information in them than was needed just to convince the Balt not to shut down the “Rainbow”. Strelok pulled it all off neatly, no denying it. Takes real talent to rake in the heat with other people’s hands. I applaud standing up.\nAlright, to hell with it... Doctor, I have one last question: do you know what a “time loop” is?
How should I put it... I once saw a picture of a snake devouring its own tail. I think it’s something like that. Like a trap you can’t escape from. Why do you ask?

One highly learned professor said that you can’t change cause and effect. Even if you invent a time machine and go back into the past, it’s still impossible to influence the future that way. This very loop will arise. So what if Strelok came to us from the future precisely for that reason? Not to destroy the Monolith, but to trap it—in a time loop?
I was happy when your memory came back, and now you’re at it again... What’s the point of all these musings? You shouldn’t be going anywhere, Marked One, there’s no sense in it.
No, Doctor, there is a point. At least for me. Thank you for everything, and goodbye. I’m unlikely to return.
You finally showed up. We were already about to head out to help you, figured you wouldn’t make it on your own.
Thanks, I can manage without your help somehow. So, what’s going on here?
What was that nonsense you spun about the weapon? We searched two bunkers. Nothing there, only lost a fighter in the far bunker, by the antennas.
Maybe it rolled off somewhere, but I definitely saw it. And I didn’t even know about the second bunker... Maybe it’s worth searching there first?

There’s nothing there, and we sealed the door so the filth wouldn’t crawl out... Anyway, we’re done playing games with you. If everything you said is true, then here’s how it goes: you go into that bunker right now, our guy will be waiting for you there. You take the device from him and look for the weapon. You carry it out here in your hands so we can see right away that it’s on you. No jokes and no hide-and-seek! Until you find the weapon, you’re not coming out of there. And if it’s not there — well, then neither will you be.
And if it’s already dissolved on its own, or that device doesn’t work... how is that my fault?

Enough yapping! They’re still putting up with you for now, but that won’t last long. If it dissolves in your hands, that means you were useless to begin with. Bottom line: you’ve got ten minutes to enter the bunker. Come out without a Monolith weapon — we shoot, no questions asked. Bring out some other weapon — same thing. Try to run — we’ll dig you out from underground and finish you off.
Hey! Hold on, the door there is coded, it’ll take time to crack it...
And how do you think we got inside? The lock’s already busted, we’ve got a specialist for that. So, what are you standing around for? Get moving.
Yeah, yeah, I’m going.
Time’s ticking.
Yeah, I remember...
So you’re the brave and fearless one, huh?
That’s me. Hand over the device.
Take it, this damn thing’s worn my arms out — some kind of alloy, I guess... And my head’s been buzzing from it, too.
Pretty heavy... Yeah, there really is something unsettling about this thing. You here alone? Not scared? All kinds of crap flies around here, throwing whatever it can.

Two of our guys squeezed through a gap into the hangar with the Electras, checking it out one more time just in case. So you’ll go alone, no escort. If you whistled us a tune about the weapon, you’re gonna regret it — get ready for a warm welcome.
Yeah, I’ve already heard that — how many times are you gonna repeat it?
What are you standing around for? Get moving, grab the gun.
You should get going already... back to your guys.
Tooth, are you still waiting for the device?
So you did manage to get it? Well done! I believed in you, and you were scared...
You’ve got something to be afraid of too. I still don’t get how I made it out alive. I advise you to leave — they’re probably on my tail. They’ll show up here for sure.
Don’t worry about me, I’ve been under fire before. Now hand it over, what kind of contraption is it?
You see, Tooth... I’m not giving this thing to you.
Fine, take it, this damn weight’s already right up to here for me!
What’s that about? You wanna sell it yourself?!
You’re a real champ. Yeah, there’s definitely something to this thing — it really does press on the brain. But it’s fine, I’ll stash it somewhere for the time being...
No. I want to check something... I’ve got a theory.\nBut in case your memory’s gone soft, we agreed that I’d provide proof, not the device itself. Here it is, feast your eyes. What more do you want?
Then tell me where the pumps are switched on.

Well, yeah... Can I photograph this thing? I’ve got information that this crap was assembled using blueprints and instructions from some nerd. It’s powered by a very rare artifact. If they built one, then another can be built too, and we’ll find the artifact. The main thing was to understand that it really exists. And after you check your guesses, maybe you’ll still give it to me?
We’ll see. Take the photos and tell me where to turn on the pumps.

Pumps, so pumps... Those documents say that after supplying power, the water can be pumped out from the lab that has an exit to the "Tesla". It’s also connected to another lab, the one on Radar, but not X-12... Damn, I always get those indices mixed up, but I think you know what I’m talking about. And just in case numbers are more familiar to you — X-12 is exactly the lab where the entrance to your flooded tunnel is. That one you should definitely know.
Uh-huh... sure. So you say an exit to the "Tesla"... I know where that is. That’s it, Tooth. Goodbye.
I went back to that tunnel where I saw your Mateyev.
And? Is he still there, or did he come with you?
He’s probably still sitting there. Stubborn ass... scared stiff, refuses to move. I did what you asked. He’ll be easy to find.
Excellent. He’ll be taken care of. And how shall we reward you?.. Are you interested in artifact transformation recipes? Or would you prefer our medical kits?
I’m interested in the recipes.
I’ll take the medical supplies, they won’t be extra.
Very well, then write it down.
Yes, health is more important, you know... Please accept a small additional sum to your account.
I’m tired, I’m leaving.
So where did that weirdo go, the one who dropped in on you naked?
Some brainy young guy came by, from Sakharov, and took him with him.
Just like that?
Not just like that. Barely got him on his feet, our guys helped get him to the gate, loaded him into a chopper and that was it.
So Sakharov provided transport?

I didn’t bother figuring out who and what. They took him — good enough. What, were we supposed to keep feeding him, watering him, taking care of him, keeping him here on a leash? He’s not some zoo animal — he’s a person. The brainy one said he recognized someone in him and wants their boss to recognize him too. I didn’t object.
Who did he recognize him as?
According to him: someone from their crowd. Why do you care?
Just asking. Guy was here, now he’s gone... Curious.
I wanted to ask how things turned out with that oddball at the Army Warehouses.
Excuse me, what?
Well, you asked for an assistant, your JR Mateyev, to be escorted. Remember?
Ah, yes, yes! So did you escort him? Where is he now? He hasn’t been in contact.
Uh... Well, he died, strayed off the route at the wrong time. I thought you already knew. I figured maybe you’d already sent someone else, so I asked.
Died?! How could this happen! And you kept silent! How did you fail to protect him?

I’m not a nanny, and this isn’t a kindergarten — it’s the Zone. I warned him not to let his guard down, but he just kept walking, whistling, humming some song about Galya, like he was at a resort and not in the Zone... That’s how he ended up where he shouldn’t have.
My God... So young. What nonsense... How could you allow this...

I didn’t allow anything. How did you allow such grad students to be sent into the Zone? Yeah, he was young, but I’m not old either. And if I had died instead of him, would that have been better? Huh! What’s the point of talking now...
He’s probably hanging around the Bar somewhere.
How can that be! You agreed to take him to the Army Warehouses. He’ll get lost...
What is he, a child, to get lost? A grown man. And we agreed that I’d only escort him as far as the Bar. Don’t worry, professor, he’ll find helpers there. An extra coin never hurts anyone.
Then why isn’t he making contact?

Well, I don’t know. You can understand him — straight from the sea and right into the Zone. He hasn’t settled in yet. He’ll pull himself together and everything will be fine, don’t worry, he’ll bring that weirdo in.
Let’s hope nothing has happened to him... And what are you waiting for? You didn’t take him to the Army Warehouses.
Well, you see... getting through the Wild Territory isn’t exactly sweet either. The ammo consumption alone, and how many repair kits went into it...
Alright, alright, here’s compensation for your spent ammo...
And medical supplies were used too...
That’s enough! You already have quite a tab here — don’t be stingy, buy instead of begging. Remember, young man: if you take a job, you finish it.
Alright, I’ll remember...
Sergeich said you needed help. How’s your dissertation coming along? I thought you were buried in work, processing the data.
The amount of material I’ve got on pseudogiants is pitiful.

Listen, Gluzov. I once ended up in an underground laboratory — the entrance was blocked, and there were no burrows at all. But the most interesting thing is, a pseudogiant was living there! And there was also a bubble hanging in the hall. Well, how do I explain it… like a balloon, but without an outer layer.
A bubble? Could it be a spatial portal? There’s a theory that bubbles in the Zone appear at points where space is punctured.

I don’t know whether it’s a portal or not, but the bubble is definitely there. And there’s other filth roaming around too. Where did it come from? Not out of thin air. Maybe it came through that portal.
You really saw a pseudogiant there?
I’m telling you for sure! Saw it as clearly as I see you.

Now that’s interesting! This could really broaden the topic… Pseudogiants alone are too narrow, we need to look wider. Because in that case, if these spatial anomalies actually function in some way, it could explain all the unpredictability and the strange fluctuations in monster population size. What prospects!
Are you saying this to me right now?
I’m thinking out loud. You’ve given me hope, Marked One. Would you be willing to serve science a little?
Drag the pseudogiant out of that lab? I won’t manage that.
No, I think we can put the pseudogiant topic on hold for now. And start new research. Could you check where that portal leads?
Uh… Jump into the bubble? It’s high up. And probably dangerous — how would I know where I’ll come out?

You see, spatial tunnels are arranged in such a way that if there is an entrance, there must also be an exit. Moreover, the direction is bidirectional. That is, where you come out, you can also enter back from there. Theoretically. I’ll give you a recorder. Jump in, place it right there, under the second bubble where you come out, and immediately return.

What?! You make it sound so simple. Hop in, hop out. Have you been in that lab yourself? I nearly went gray there. Just getting into it was a feat, and now you’re suggesting I jump somewhere else. What do I need this for? And why did you decide that the portal even works? There are plenty of bubbles in the Zone — you step into them and get nothing.

You see, there was one study of a similar portal, unfortunately it collapsed long ago. During a blowout, at one of the entry points of the spatial tunnel… how should I put it… a clot of some unknown energy forms, which changes the properties of anomalous formations. Or artifacts, as you call them. That’s an interesting topic too, but right now I’m interested in the portal itself and registering movement through it… And if you say that monsters were present in a completely sealed space long ago, that’s what suggests the portal is open.
Hold on! Don’t overload me. Tell me straight — what’s in it for me? I respect science, sure, but understand me correctly. I’ve got my own interests, and you’ve got yours.

If we speak in your stalker language, then at the entry or exit point of a spatial portal during a blowout, artifacts can change their properties with a fairly high probability. A kind of quantum leap. And the pleasant news for you stalkers is that the change goes in the direction of improvement, if it even makes sense to talk about improvements of anomalous formations. But from your point of view — they can become better. As for the probability, it depends not so much on the blowout itself as on the portal — though it can vary…

Now that’s a whole different conversation! So… do I understand correctly that if I leave, say, a slightly radioactive Jellyfish there, then after a blowout it might become completely free of negative properties? And what’s the probability of that happening?
No, to hell with science and this “improvement”. It’s too dangerous. I’ll think about it.

Yes, you’ve understood correctly. As for the probability… Look, I’m giving you the recorder. Move to the opposite end of that portal and leave it right at the landing point. After installation, the device will display a message indicating the start of operation. Once the blowout passes, retrieve it and bring it to me. I’ll get the data I need, and we’ll also understand the energy concentration in this specific portal. Then I’ll be able to answer your question about probability. But keep in mind — this is just an experiment. Nothing can be guaranteed. But if it works out, it will be a real breakthrough!

Sounds like a worthwhile job. It’s just that the bubble is hanging pretty high. I’ll probably need jump artifacts, and more than one… Alright, I’ll figure something out. But you keep in mind too — since it’s an experiment, I don’t guarantee anything either.
Of course. Still, I’ll be waiting for results from you.
See you, science.

\nGluzov — a scientist from the Swamps — asks you to check where the portal from the X-18 control room leads. You need to somehow manage to jump into the bubble and leave the device at the exit point, then retrieve it after the blowout and bring it back to Gluzov.
Well, you sure gave me a task with that bubble!
So? Did it work out? You got into it and made it back?
As you can see, I’m standing in front of you, so I made it back. But if only you knew what it cost me.
I understand, I understand, the price of the matter and all that… But what about the device, did it record any data?
Here’s your little device. Did everything just like you said — tossed it, waited out the blowout, picked it up.
Let me quickly read some of the parameters and it’ll be clear that that’s exactly what happened…
You don’t believe me? Well, read it.
Hmm… So… Yes, there really was a blowout… So… The data is there, it needs to be analyzed thoroughly. And regarding your probability, I can already tell you something.
Well, don’t keep me in suspense!

Just a moment… let me estimate… Whoa! If I didn’t make a mistake in the calculations, it comes out to almost a 100% probability of artifact improvement during a blowout. But specifically at that point — that’s important. Plus or minus about ten meters. There are also several limitations. First, the artifact must not be degenerate, having lost all its anomalous properties. Second, the modulation of the energy field is such that it only affects artifacts no higher than the third category. And lastly — the release of energy occurs along an extremely narrow vector, and therefore can affect only one artifact per cycle. If even one condition is not met… well, if you want, you can check for yourself what will happen.

Almost 100 percent?! That’s something else, hard to believe! I should find a suitable artifact to test it on, something I wouldn’t mind losing too much if things go wrong. Especially since the terrain there is so unlucky that the artifact could easily roll off somewhere.

I get the hint. I actually have one just like that. If you simply decide to keep the artifact as a reward for your efforts, I won’t mind at all, but I’d still appreciate it if, when you get the chance, you try to improve it and then come back and tell me what came of it. And don’t forget to bring the resulting sample with you. Just please, don’t carry it on your belt, alright? As for the terrain… I think nothing terrible will happen if, to keep the artifact fixed in place, you put it… even into an ordinary backpack, the kind stalkers use to store their loot.
If everything works the way you said, I’ll find the time to drop by. See you.
I’ve got a question. Do you know anything about the "Pendulums"?
I know there are such artifacts. Very rare, and therefore expensive.
Yeah, rare. How could I get my hands on one? Maybe there are recipes for them, ever heard of any?
Why are you asking me?
Because you seem to be on Yantar quite often, on good terms with the scientific crowd, I guess. Maybe someone mentioned those "Pendulums" to you over tea?
I don’t quite get you. Looking for an artifact, go to Sanya Banker. Need a recipe — go to Tooth. You’re not a rookie, after all.
Alright... let’s approach this from another angle. Do you know anything about the connection between "Pendulums" and "Labyrinths"? And most importantly, can they be used to bring memories back?

Ah! So that’s where you’re headed... At first I thought you wanted to make a killing brewing "Pendulums". But that’s a dead end — way too complicated and costly. It’s probably easier to find a "Pendulum" than to brew one.
So you do know a recipe?
There is something on the subject. Unverified information. And so far there’s been no chance to check it. But why did you even decide that a "Pendulum" would help you remember anything?
I had a conversation once... Anyway, it’s just a hypothesis. But I’d like to work this version through.

I suppose I’ll try to clarify what’s going on with the recipe, since you need it so badly. And at the same time I’ll think about what I’ll want from you in return. Let’s get back to this conversation later.
Alright. I’m here often, I’ll drop by from time to time.
Anything new?

Looking for work? I’ve got a job just for you. That weapon prototype you recovered is completely out of charges. Turns out it runs on some kind of tricky battery. The energy cost for a single shot is enormous. How to rework that battery so the charge would last for at least ten shots — I have no idea.
Well, you’ve got plenty of smart guys around the Bar. Give it to them, let them rack their brains.

We already assembled a "council" of the local bright minds. Came up with nothing. But at least they pointed us to a scientist named Oganesyan, who’s holed up somewhere in the Swamps. He either studies, or used to study, low-energy systems.
So what’s the problem? Why did you say this job was specifically for me? Surely you’ve got someone of your own to send to chat with the nerds?

Can’t you guess? If not that many people know Fang was working on some unusual weapon, then the results of that work are known to only a handful. And you’re one of them. I’d prefer it to stay that way.
Got it. So I just need to ask the nerds in the Swamps about the possibility of improving the battery?

Roughly speaking, yes. More precisely, we want to find out whether it’s possible to increase the capacity so the charge would last, say, for about ten shots. That’s the first thing. The second: if it is, can production of such batteries be put on a conveyor, preferably entirely within the Zone.
I still haven’t heard what’s in it for me.

Remember our talk about "Pendulums" and the recipe? I made some inquiries, and here’s what turned up: "Pendulums" really do form in the "Labyrinth" anomaly, but with an extremely low probability, first of all. And secondly, you still have to manage to fish the artifact out of a solid field of "Bungees". But the probability can be significantly increased if you toss something into the center of the "Labyrinth" — a kind of "germ" of a future "Pendulum". Something of the same nature. How do you like that teaser?
I’d like some details. What kind of "germ" of the same nature? And most importantly — does the "Pendulum" really help bring memories back?

Hold your horses. I’ll sketch the big picture for you first, straight from the words of smart people. A "Pendulum" is like a conductor of psi-energy. And the "Labyrinth" is sort of an antenna. Standing with a "Pendulum" in the center of a "Labyrinth", you can send something like a mental query — don’t ask me to whom — and receive a response. In your case, for example, that could be returning memories. And that’s where the charity event called "free info" ends. We’ll talk about the rest when you complete my assignment.
So, you’re saying I should go to the nerds in the Swamps? Alright, I’ll give it a try.

Here’s the battery. You’ll figure out on the spot how to approach science. And don’t get fussy — if they ask for a favor in return, meet them halfway. Oh, and keep in mind, this battery is unique, so be careful with it.
One of a kind in the whole Zone, then? Better not lose it...
I want to talk about the battery for Fang’s gun.
Have you already found out what I asked you?
No... I’m just reminding you so you don’t worry. Everything’s in progress, there’ll be results soon.
Yes. I found out a few things.
Report.

So, I handed the battery over to the nerd Oganesyan. He did some thinking, gave me what he called a “laboratory prototype” and sent me to the Foggy Thicket for a field test. I carried it out successfully. Long story short, skipping the extra details, everything seems to have worked, according to him, but there are some nuances. You’d better get in touch with him yourself now and discuss the details directly.
Hold on! The battery I gave you — did it stay with him? And I get nothing in return except your verbal “report”?!

First of all, my “verbal report” comes with this paperwork from Oganesyan, with detailed explanations of who’s at fault and what needs to be done. Secondly, what result were you expecting? That they’d assemble a finished product for you there in five minutes and I’d deliver it? First, one experiment had to be conducted, which I helped with — for free, by the way. Now, as I understand it, a second one is needed. But we agreed that I’d just go to the Swamps to chat with the science types, not take a part-time job as a lab assistant. Bottom line, everything’s in the instructions. Decide for yourself who’s going to continue these experiments. I’m out.
Alright, let’s read what these instructions are about. So… laboratory prototype. Is that the one you carried into the thicket? Where is it?
It stayed there, in the Swamps…
Here, barely managed to make it.
There’s also mention of an artifact called “Accumulator”. Did he give you one of those?
That’s just an ordinary starter battery, isn’t it? And it also mentions an artifact called “Accumulator”. Did he give you one of those?
No, of course not. Like someone would just hand me artifacts for nothing, yeah right.

Don’t pay attention to the casing. They used whatever was at hand. Basically, it’s just a container charged with anomalous energy. And I don’t have an artifact like that. Like someone would just hand me artifacts for nothing, yeah right.
Alright, we’ll consider the assignment completed. Here, this is for your efforts.
Thanks, of course, but what about the “Pendulums”? You promised to give me the details.

I don’t know the details. Wow, look how your face stretched right away. I warned you — the information is unverified. As for recalling certain episodes from the past with the help of this artifact — that part is solid. At least my… uh… scientific consultant considers it quite likely. But as for obtaining the artifact itself… I don’t know the recipe, but I can put you in touch with someone who does. Or thinks he does. The primary source, so to speak.
Well, Petrenko… you sly bastard. I’ve got no words.

Marked One, don’t strike a pose, alright? I gave you a working battery, and you screwed up. And instead of a clear result, you’re shunting me off to another guy who, on paper, suggests hauling some contraption God knows where, after first getting hold of a rare artifact. So as far as I’m concerned, we’re even.
Alright. Let’s drop it. So who is this mysterious bearer of “unverified” knowledge?

Brainiac Ilya. You know that stalker? He mostly hangs around somewhere in the Tesla Zone, and there happens to be a “Labyrinth” in those parts. I think he could well have gotten pretty good at unraveling the secrets of that anomaly.
Got it. A dead end, basically. If fate drags me into the Tesla Zone, and if Brainiac Ilya hasn’t kicked the bucket yet, I’ll ask him, sure. But I don’t really believe in a successful outcome.
I dropped by to check how things are going here. Anything for me?
Marked One, maybe you’ll finally finish what you started? I mean the whole business with the battery and those experiments.
We already settled everything. You yourself said we were even.
That’s true. But I’m offering you a new job, even if it’s on the old topic. With separate payment, of course. You’ll choose for yourself from what I can offer. Ammo, grenades, or money, finally.
So what’s the job about?

Remember Oganesyan’s instructions, the scientist from the Swamps, the ones you brought? I want to finish his experiment… without involving outsiders. That’s why I’m offering it to you. If you refuse, I’ll understand, no hard feelings. I’ll find someone else eventually, but I really don’t want to bring an external contractor into the details of such a… delicate matter.
You’re always spinning secrets… If you were less secretive, it’d have been done long ago. Alright, let’s say I agree. What did the instructions say?

First, you need to go and retrieve the “laboratory prototype”. You said it was left in the Swamps. Second, we need the artifact “Accumulator”. In theory, with its help it’s possible to transform the anomalous energy, which this “battery” is currently saturated with, into the electrical kind we’re used to. But that will require certain manipulations.

First, we need that very “laboratory prototype”. I’ll provide it to you, of course. Second, we need the artifact “Accumulator”. In theory, with its help it’s possible to transform the anomalous energy, which this “battery” is currently saturated with, into the electrical kind we’re used to. But that will require certain manipulations.
What kind?

The battery together with the artifact must be taken to the “Tesla Zone” and left there for a short while near any “Electra” anomaly. The note says that after an hour or two the artifact should transmute, that is, change. That will be the indicator that the process is complete. After that, this damn thing will have to be hauled back to Oganesyan. How else are we supposed to make sure everything went right?!
Yeah… I could’ve figured that out myself. Alright, I understand everything. Hand over the “Accumulator”.
Yeah… I could’ve figured that out myself. Alright, I understand everything. Hand over the battery and… uh… the other “Accumulator”.

There’s a snag. I don’t have that artifact. And I don’t know the recipe. Oganesyan is out of luck on that front too. Bottom line, you’ll have to get it somewhere on your own. I’ll compensate the expenses, don’t worry.

There’s a snag. I don’t have that artifact. And I don’t know the recipe. Oganesyan is out of luck on that front too. Bottom line, you’ll have to get it somewhere on your own. I’ll compensate the expenses, don’t worry. And the battery — here it is, stuff it into your backpack.
Every time I think that this time for sure the client won’t be able to surprise me with anything, something like this happens… Don’t tell me you’ll only pay if the experiment is successful.
Sounds tempting. Just kidding. It’ll be enough for me if the scientist confirms the very fact that the experiment was carried out and outlines the general prospects, if any appear, of course.

I’m already full of anticipation for the unforgettable impressions from carrying out this job. I only hope I’ll have enough patience not to throw this piece of junk into the nearest ditch in about twenty minutes.

Petrenko asks you to finish the experiment on charging the battery, a device assembled by the scientist Oganesyan from the Swamps. To do this, you need to drag the unit to the “Tesla Zone” and leave it near any “Electra” anomaly together with the similarly named artifact “Accumulator” for an hour or two. A variety of rewards of your choice is promised.
Are you still interested in the experiment with the battery?
Of course. Everything worked out, I hope?

Uh-huh. I hauled the contraption over to Oganesyan in the Swamps. He spent quite a while expressing his delight, which is to say everything’s fine. I told him you’d be getting in touch with him soon, so the rest is up to you two.

Excellent, Marked One! I knew I could rely on you. I remember I promised compensation for the artifact, so here’s a check for a thousand greens right away.\nNow choose the main reward: I can give you about a hundred and fifty rounds for the SVD, or about ten VOGs and the same number of hand grenades. As another option — I can write you another check.
Sniper rounds wouldn’t go amiss.
I’ll take the VOGs and grenades.
Better give me another check, I’ve already got all that junk.
As you wish. Drop by if anything comes up.
I will, where would I go.
Do you know anything about the "Pendulums"?
A bit, but I’d like to know more. Want to hand over a "Pendulum" to me?
No. I want to know if there are recipes for them.
I’d like to know that too. I can offer a good price for a recipe.
I actually wanted to ask you. Thought you knew everything.
If I knew everything, there’d be no point in gathering information. Why bother, if you already know it all? So, are you selling the recipe, or are you just good at wagging your tongue?
I don’t have such a recipe.
I remember you saying you’d pay well for a "Pendulum" recipe.
You picked a fine time to ask. You’re too late, Marked One. I already know. You’re not the only smart one around.
So you don’t need it? What if my recipe is something special...

Don’t jack up the price and don’t play the expert. There are no special "Pendulum" recipes, they’re all the same. I’ve already found that out, and I’m not about to pay for the same thing a third time. Smartasses, honestly. So take that little piece of paper with your recipe and stick it... well, you know where.
And who told you the recipe?
I took a trip to the Monolith the other day and made a wish — to learn all the recipes.
Funny guy. Didn’t really want it that badly anyway...
Do you know anything about Labyrinths?
Huh?
Kep from the Barrier said you mentioned something about it.
What did I say? When? My head’s not working...
Maybe you’ll knock back a shot to stimulate your memory?
Ah... yeah... that’s a good thing for straightening the head out. Alright then, you’re buying.
I don’t have any on me.
Sheesh... and here I was getting my hopes up...
I’ll come back.
Alright, here you go, just don’t overdo it.
Don’t worry about me... What about you? Not drinking? Suit yourself, we’re not proud, can drink alone. Ah! So... what were you saying there?
I’m saying, tell me about Labyrinths.
Well, what can I say... the guys went there. Ours... the ones who were looking for a way through the Thicket, to go around Duty.
Well...
What do you mean, “well”? Haven’t gotten going yet... Hold on, I’ll pour some more.
You pour, just don’t forget the story.

Ah! So they walked there, walked and walked, and didn’t get anywhere. Couldn’t reach the center of the "Labyrinth", which means they didn’t find a passage between the "Bungees", and they didn’t have the sense to bring a "Springboard" with them. With that, they would’ve slipped through easy.\nAnyway! Night was coming on, time to head back. You know how time flies in the Foggy Thicket... I don’t drink as fast as time flies there... And how they even managed to remember something everyone had long forgotten...
Remember what? Who?

Those guys... They hadn’t remembered it for a hundred years, and those lads who knew were long gone... And then suddenly, you see, they remembered. And it hit them right there in the head, they bolted at once and came running back... And then they start shaking me, who, what, how... Ah! All that’s in the past... Forget it.
I don’t get it. They suddenly remembered something there, in the center of the "Labyrinth"?

You don’t need to get it, it’s none of your business... I told them too — there was nothing, I don’t know anything, they were stoned, or while they were getting tossed around near the center their brains just jammed up... They seemed to back off me... So you don’t ask either, there was nothing.
Alright. And why did they need to get to the center of the "Labyrinth" in the first place?
Huh? You don’t know or what? You can find special artifacts there... "Pendulums"... Or maybe you can’t find them... Maybe you have to brew them there.
Can you tell me more? Is there a recipe for these "Pendulums"? And what do you know about them in general?

I don’t know a damn thing... You think if I’m a cook, then I know all the recipes... No, I don’t know. I know how to cook borscht... entr?es... ca— cats. There. Out of cats... I know that too. But they said there’s supposedly a recipe... And I’ve never seen the "Pendulums" myself... Come on, don’t stall, pull out some more!
Hold on! You’ll get loaded now and forget everything altogether... So do you know anything about recipes for these artifacts or not?
Some smart guy in the Bar seems to know... or maybe not in the Bar. What’s his name...
Who?
Ah! I don’t know anyone there... They were saying they took the recipe from someone. Said there’s a guy... hangs around the nerds a lot...
And why does he go to the nerds so often?
Well, probably turns in artifacts. What else for... Or maybe takes them from them and peddles them... I don’t really care...
Yeah. No matter where you look, everything in the Zone revolves around that — just some cover it up with ideas, and others with science...
What? Who? So why aren’t you pouring? That’s it, or what? You just teased me...
That’s enough for you. There’s no more, and no point in getting you drunk... You don’t know anything about recipes or about the "Pendulums".
Ivan Sergeich, I was told you’re running some kind of experiments with energy here.
You probably meant experiments... No. Our primary field is biology.
And the secondary one?
Well, that’s a classified topic... What exactly are you interested in?
Well... someone asked me to look into it... Is anyone in the Swamps working with energetics, or whatever it’s called?
Mmm... One group is conducting research in that area, not too far from here — in the western part of the Swamps. They have a field camp there.
Got it. I’ll drop by when I get the chance.
You told me about the "Labyrinth" before, remember?

Yeah. There’s one here. There’s also a strange bubble hanging in the air in its center. Want to repeat Strelok’s path? I figured that out right away when you first asked about it. Wouldn’t recommend it...
I remember. Do you remember you promised to bring me some vodka? It’s dreary here...
Why? You said Strelok passed the "Labyrinth".

I said Strelok might have tried to do it. But who knows how that venture turned out, if it even happened at all. And even if he did pass through it, where did the "Labyrinth" lead him? Where is he now? Neither among the living, nor among the dead. Neither with us, nor with THEM.
How do you know? Maybe he went in and came out on the other end of the Zone, or even beyond it.
I can sense it. I sense all of THEM, those who are already THERE. And he is neither here nor THERE...

A weighty argument, can’t argue with that. Alright then, I wanted to ask about something else. Petrenko — you know him? — told me you know how one can obtain the artifact "Pendulum" in one of the "Labyrinths".
What pendulum-schmendulum? My soul is what’s penduluming, no peace for it...
What, you’ve got vodka for me? Nothing but drunks all around...
Not for drinking’s sake, I told you. I want a cure for my gloom. Come on, don’t be stingy. Put out at least five bottles.
I don’t have any vodka. Let’s manage without it somehow.
Here, take it, just don’t torment yourself. Hope this adds some sense to you.
Ah! You don’t understand... You can’t do without it here. It’s hard.
Now that’s more like it. Hold on, I’ll knock one back right away...
Damn you, I’ll bring you vodka. Wait.
Cheered up quick, I see? So what about the "Pendulum"?

They are produced exclusively by "Labyrinths", but very rarely. And yet there is one way to obtain a "Pendulum" with a guarantee. To do this, you need to lay out one of the special artifacts in the center of the anomaly, and then after the nearest blowout it will transform into an unusual capsule, inside which will be what you are looking for.
And which artifact needs to be laid out, what is it called?
I don’t know. As far as I know, they are all still nameless. The scientists only assigned them special numbers.
I think I get what you mean. Alright. You said the method is "guaranteed". So you’ve tested it yourself, I take it? Probably right here in this "Labyrinth"?
No, what are you talking about! Only fools go in there, you can’t get out. There are other "Labyrinths". In the thicket, and also closer to the center of the Zone.
So did you try it in the Foggy Thicket, or where?
I didn’t try it anywhere. But I know it’s true. I spoke with one of THEM. One of those who are on the OTHER side. That’s what he said.
Damn it all! And I almost bought it... Another dead end. Another Zone legend. Spirits whispered it to him, apparently...

You’re laughing for nothing. You go to the edge of "Tesla", if you’ve got the guts. There’s a bubble there. If you have the artifact "Compass" with you, you’ll be able to transfer with it to the OTHER side. Only then it won’t be funny anymore. Then you’ll see clearly, finding yourself among THEM...
Did the spirits whisper that to you too?

You’re all the same... Nobody listens to anyone, you interrupt each other, chatter nonstop. But you sit down, listen, feel the Zone. Don’t fuss, don’t chase loot, focus your attention on the wonders around you — and then THEY will speak to you themselves. But you’re always in a hurry, always late for something. For you there’s only your own “me” and your own “want”. Ask THEM what the Zone wants from you. From all of us...
Alright, alright... calm down. I’d sit here with you and talk to the spirits, but business still comes first. Another time. Anything else to add?

Even now, during our conversation, you keep rushing me. That’s why I forgot to add that there is another artifact suitable for the role of a future “embryo” — the "Boulder". And one more thing: don’t try to obtain more than one "Pendulum" at a time by throwing suitable artifacts into the "Labyrinth". Only one will ripen anyway.

An important addition, thanks. I’ll still have to try this method. At least to clear my conscience and to finally close the question of the "Pendulums". That’s it, Ilyukha, keep talking to the spirits, and it’s time for me to go.
Someone was carrying someone out of a dangerous place... It’s unclear who and where. But Fang was there!
So you’re still sitting here?
Well, yes. We’re analyzing, deriving statistical data... working, in short. How about you? The artifact I gave you — did you manage to transform it? Were my calculations confirmed?
I haven’t really had the time yet. And going back into that place again is kind of scary. Maybe I’ll try later.
Yeah. That’s why I came — to tell you. I managed to turn that "Soul" into cash.

Really?! That means my calculations were correct! Of course, it would be good to have several control transformations for the sake of completeness, but even a single confirmation is already a breakthrough! Marked One, you have no idea how great you are! Where is it, the artifact?! Show me what you ended up with.
Where, where... It’s locked up. Waiting for its owner.
I can show it, but so what?
Be sure to bring it, this is very important! We need to run an analysis urgently! And, Marked One, I’ll try not to remain in your debt.

What do you mean, “so what”?! If this really is an artifact with entirely positive characteristics, then some research must be conducted. To determine whether the structure of the artifact has changed, or whether it has simply altered its properties. How stable its current, new properties are, and how long they can persist. If you’re interested, then I gave you an artifact that was, how should I put it... “cooked”, not a natural one.
I’ll think about it... It wasn’t easy for me to get it.
And do you know how to tell a “cooked” artifact from one found in the field? And what difference does it even make?

Let’s say I have a hypothesis on that matter. In fact, our experiment with you is precisely meant to help me move in that direction. This is the first such phenomenon in my, and indeed in scientific practice in general. So, what do you say? Shall we make a deal?
A phenomenon, you say... Then the reward should be appropriate. I’ll say right away — I’m not interested in what Pakhom changes.
There is a very rare modifier recipe, discovered quite recently. Previously it was almost unknown in the stalker community. Have you heard of the modifier "Tears of the Giant"?
Hm... Even those cry?! You’ve convinced me, take the artifact, study it.
Thank you, Marked One. You won’t regret it, be sure of that. The properties of this modifier will please you. Write it down.
See you, science... I’ll go enjoy myself.
I’ve got something to talk about.
What did you want?
I wanted to ask about that strange guy from your story... You remember the talk about the blowout, the anti-telepathy artifact?
You seemed to know Fang, right? At the Bar they told me a few things about him. And about how you used to go places on his errands.
Yeah.
So?
Could it have been Fang, by any chance? At the Bar they told me a few things about him. And about how you used to go places on his errands.
Let’s say it was Fang. So what?

The thing is, I’m trying to piece together a complete picture from scattered fragments of information. You know I’m looking for Strelok. Fang was one of his associates and built various gadgets for him, including some kind of unusual weapon. As I understand it, he obtained parts for this weapon in different places. For example, at the Bar, through Prapor, who at the time was in charge of Duty’s warehouses. And you helped him with that. Correct me if I’m wrong somewhere.
That’s all correct. I see you’re not wasting your time. I just don’t get what you’re getting at.
I already said my main goal is to find Strelok. That’s why I’m gathering any information related to him, looking for any traces and leads. Tell me about Fang.

Well, he seems to have disappeared several months ago. There are rumors he died. So I don’t know how useful my story will be to you, but... alright, listen.\nWe’d known each other for a long time. Not close friends, but we met often, drank together, naturally. He was a tech genius, as they say, God-gifted. He could literally cobble together all sorts of useful things from junk and scraps, on the fly. He knew weapons inside out. He and old Vergas often had arguments about that, sometimes to the point of shouting. And in general, he helped many stalkers with technical matters. That’s why he was respected.
By the way, about weapons. The very one you helped Fang get parts for — can you tell me anything about it?
I never saw it myself. I don’t even know if he finished it. The last time I talked to Fang, he said there was still a lot to be refined.
Alright. And have you heard anything about the so-called group of Strelok? Maybe Fang told you about it?

No, Fang didn’t talk much about their group. I know that besides Strelok himself and Fang, there was Ghost in it. And Doctor also had dealings with them, apparently. Well, you know Doc yourself. Fang was their tech guy and handled supplies. Or maybe he was just running errands, I didn’t really dig into it. Fang and Doctor showed up on the Cordon often, while the other two stayed in the shadows all the time...
Listen, why didn’t you tell me all this earlier, if you knew I was interested in Strelok?
You didn’t ask about Fang or their group. And Strelok... well, who knows who else he was friends with in the Zone. In any case, I didn’t know him personally.
Alright. Did Fang ever share any thoughts with you about Strelok?

Just a little. He said that Strelok himself was a big mystery to him. No one knows where he’s from, how old he is, or who he was before he became a stalker. For a newcomer to the Zone, he turned out to be remarkably nimble and lucky. By the way, just like you, Marked One... I think he was an extraordinary person if he managed to put together a group of such different, dissimilar people. I don’t know what bound them all together, but Strelok was definitely calling the shots. One former Clear Sky member said that at one point they were all holed up in the Swamps. Until the leadership of "Clear Sky" suddenly decided that Strelok and his associates were somehow disrupting the established order in the Zone, upsetting some kind of balance. Later there were even rumors that Strelok decided to shut the Zone down as a phenomenon. That completely ruined their relations.
How’s that? The Zone isn’t a tavern where they pour bootleg vodka. How can you “shut it down”?
I have no idea. If you hadn’t noticed, nothing happened to the Zone, so... Be that as it may, Clear Sky vanished almost completely, unlike Strelok and his company.
Uh-huh, I’ve heard something like that in passing. And what did Strelok’s people do after that?

I think only Strelok himself knew exactly what the group was up to. Once Fang let slip that they were planning something big. It seems they managed to dig up something serious. They dug deep, almost reaching the very center of the Zone. Since, as you know, the surface route is blocked by the Brain Scorcher, I didn’t understand how they got through. But Fang didn’t know the details; he didn’t take part in those raids.
So what did they dig up there?! Alright. You said Doctor and Fang often appeared on the Cordon. Doc is clear enough. But what was Fang doing there?
