Mainly running back and forth to Sidor, stocking up on things from him. He dropped by Vergas to chat too, but I already mentioned that. Sometimes he’d just sit by the campfire with the youngsters, enlightening and instructing them.
So, Sidorovich and Vergas. I shouldn’t forget to question them as well. Thanks, Wolf. I’m off.
Sidorovich, do you know a stalker by the nickname Fang?
The handyman one? Yeah, I know him. Hasn’t shown up around here in a long while, if that’s what you’re asking.
No, I wanted to ask something else. I know he used to drop by your place often. Can you tell me why?
Ordered various parts through me—spare parts, components, documentation and manuals for them. What exactly—that’s none of your business. Trade secret. Mind your own business.
To hell with the spare parts. What do you know about Fang’s ties with Strelok and some guy called Ghost?
I don’t know anything. Me and Fang talked business, not heart-to-heart chats. And you, Marked One, that’s enough chatter. You looking to buy or sell? No? Then don’t block the light.
Vergas, do you know Fang?
Knew him. Stubborn as a mule, that guy was. Once he started arguing about weapons, that was it—might as well call the saints. Ah, well... Speak either good of the dead or nothing at all.
Funny, where did the rumor that Fang is dead even come from? Tell me, Vergas, did you personally see his body?
No, but I know well the one who saw his grave. That’s how I found out. And I’ve got no reason not to trust that man.
Oh really? And where is Fang’s grave?
Somewhere in the Red Forest. Why are you asking?
I’m looking for his... associate, a stalker called Strelok. Didn’t Fang ever mention him to you?
No. Don’t recall.
Shame. Looks like that lead just ran dry.
Listen, I’ve been meaning to ask you for a while—why is it that every time we meet you keep spouting some kind of nonsense? No offense, but what’s with all the secrets and half-answers?
You’re awfully curious, Marked One. That’s not always good for your health, you know.
Come on, cut it out, alright? You know I’m looking for Strelok. Petrenko told me you knew his right-hand man, Fang. That true?
What “true”? True that I knew him, or true that Petrenko told you?
You’re not easy to deal with. I’m asking you man to man: if you know anything about Strelok or Fang, please tell me.
Man to man? And you’re sure you’re a man?
Oh, that’s it. Maybe I’ll come back some other time, when you’re in a better mood.
There’s a guy hanging around the Bar, kind of disgruntled. They call him Prapor.
Disgruntled—that’s for sure.
Why’s he always grumbling? Can’t even have a proper talk with him.

Marked One, if I weren’t running the Bar, and if their leadership wasn’t hanging around here, I’d talk about it. But as it stands—go ask the stalkers for gossip. Those blabbermouths don’t care, but I’m not in a position to spread rumors. Clear? You buying something—I’ll sell, that’s what I’m here for. But wagging my tongue isn’t my specialty.
Tell me about a Duty member. They call him Prapor.
Yeah, there’s one. Commands the Duty checkpoint at the Garbage. Always whining about his ailments.
Not that one—the other. Hangs around the Bar, also supposedly Prapor—same last name or something.
Ah... that one. There was a story with him. I can share—if you’ve got something to wet my throat with.
Got it, I’ll bring some.
Alright, I’ll pour.
That’s the way. Well then! To Prapor and his promotion.
Promotion?

For a time Prapor was in charge of ammo, weapons, food and other supplies. Sort of the quartermaster for Duty. Or “logistics officer,” if you want to sound fancy. You didn’t think Petrenko had been running the stock all his life, did you?
Honestly, I never really thought about it. So what happened next?

These days Prapor’s out of the loop. They didn’t kick him out—Duty still needs people—but they booted him from the post. They say Petrenko edged him out himself... or at least set the whole thing in motion.
Booted him for what?

What for? Embezzlement, as they say—on a particularly large scale. Valuable Duty property. Caught him red-handed. The brass probably knew about the scheme for a while, but they wanted him with the evidence in hand. Duty’s full of former cops, wherever you look. Still got their cop habits.\nThere was this stalker—a jack-of-all-trades—Fang. Back then Prapor passed him something extremely valuable. Or was about to, but didn’t get the chance. That I don’t know. Fang eventually laid low, stopped coming around here. Duty started digging and found out Prapor had done deals with him more than once.
And what was so valuable that Fang was getting through Prapor?

How should I know? But their business was well set up—that’s for sure. To the point where Fang sometimes sent other stalkers in his place, probably so he wouldn’t draw too much attention.\nAnyway, now Petrenko runs everything. Between us—he trades in property too, but it’s small stuff compared to Prapor. And some things he’s officially allowed to sell and trade with stalkers. Still, you can often arrange something special under the counter...
Alright... What about the stalkers Fang sent to pick up goods—do you know any of them?
Not really... Maybe just Wolf. Saw him here once with Fang. They were standing with Prapor, hashing something out. Later Wolf dropped by his storeroom a few times on his own.
Oh really? And what does Prapor even do now?

Loafs around. Walks about puffing up his cheeks. They removed him, but still haven’t given him a new post. They wouldn’t drum him out anyway. Heard one of the senior officers stood up for him. And during the investigation Prapor talked his way out of it—said he was helping out selflessly, claimed he got nothing from Fang and was acting for the good of Duty. Kept insisting Fang was crafting some special weapon that would help Duty win a decisive victory over the spawn of the Zone... and so on. They also say Prapor’s practically on buddy-buddy terms with Voronin himself. So you figure it out.
Did Fang really craft something for Prapor?

Who knows? Sounds more like a scam, though... anything’s possible. You’d be better off staying out of their business. That whole bunch of “ideological comrades” is really a jar of spiders. Duty’ll fall apart one day, mark my words. They’ll eat each other alive.
Whether it falls apart or not—I don’t really care. I’ve got my own problems to sort out. I’ll try to question Wolf about this whole story when I get the chance.
So how are you holding up here?
Ah, you know... Worse than it was, but better than it’ll be. I’m sick of hanging around here. What do you think, will I ever get out of here at all?
I’m sure you will. Just be patient...\nI wanted to ask you something. They told me at the Bar that you were working on some unusual weapon.
I’ve worked on all sorts of things. Weapons too. Fixed up a TOZ for one guy, a Kalash for another—you can’t even remember it all.
This one was special. Supposedly a prototype, a demonstration model.

Ah! There was one, yeah. But I never finished it. I was working from Strelok’s blueprints. No idea where he even got them... I told him it wouldn’t be able to fire. Where was I supposed to find that kind of charge? And he goes: don’t worry, the charge isn’t your problem—just build the thing itself. So I did my best.
Did you try firing it?

I did. Strelok brought a couple of strange batteries to test it with. Said he couldn’t get more yet, that he was missing some special substance. I thought he was joking, pulling my leg. I loaded it, aimed at a rock—and when it went off, it blasted that rock to pieces. A fragment nearly smacked me in the head. I told him he could’ve warned me, I’d have stepped back. And he just scratched his head and said there was a slight miscalculation. Said it needed a bit of redesign.
Redesign what, the battery?
No, the construction itself—focus the beam more.
Did you redesign it?
Yeah. But I didn’t test it again. Figured to hell with it, let him fire it himself. Maybe he miscalculated again and I’d end up losing an arm for good.
And where is this weapon now?
What weapon? It was just another one of Strelok’s experiments. You were right—it’s a prototype.
Prototype or not. Where is it?

I left it in a stash, in the Foggy Thicket. There’s a secret little cave under the lake there. I used to keep some things there, and it protects from emissions too. Later I went to check the stash, and the gun was gone... I looked for it—couldn’t find it. Must’ve dropped it somewhere around there while sorting through my junk.
And how did Strelok react to it going missing?

Not at all. His head’s always full of ideas. He probably already forgot about the piece. Or decided to come up with something else, something better. I remember he was poring over a list of new parts for a long time—all for his experiments.
Got it. I’ll try to find your cave under the lake and search around there. Don’t lose heart, Fang. It’ll all work out, you’ll see.
Professor, I meant to tell you. You gave me that helmet for Fang, remember?
Yes, of course. No transmission from Agroprom ever followed. I had begun to think our patient had perished and that you had abandoned the matter. So what of him—when will you deliver him?
I didn’t abandon it, and I gave him the helmet. It’s just that he didn’t go to the surface, he went... somewhere else.
Somewhere else? Why? How could you—ruin such an experiment! Did you consider what will happen to him now?! I still receive no signal from the helmet—he has surely already perished.
He should be fine, I think. And your helmet... well, the electronics glitch a bit in that place...
So the helmet isn’t functioning either? That’s even worse! And I had such hopes for you...
I didn’t really think about that at the time... But Fang isn’t on the surface yet anyway.
Exactly—you didn’t think! Ah, such a unique... no matter—you’ve disrupted all the plans.
Why are you taking this so hard, Professor? Fang is still alive. He must be alive... And thank God for that. We’ll think of something.
Yes, I’m a bit on edge, forgive me... Very well, I shall report the failure and write it off. There are more important matters to attend to.
Write what off? Whom?
The helmet will be written off as a lost asset. That is all. The matter is closed.
Alright then...
Doctor, I wanted to tell you about Fang.
Any new information?
I contacted Sakharov and he made a special helmet. Fang told me you had plans to settle him somewhere here, but you were afraid to send him through a teleporter.
Yes. He probably would not have made it without protection. What about the helmet? Did you give it to Fang, and did he come out at Agroprom?
I gave him that helmet and the "Compass" you left. He teleported here. The helmet protected him.
Here? To the Thicket? That's good. I've wanted that for a long time.
He said he knows that cave by touch and can make it from the teleporter to his shelter. He'll stay there and wait.

Good, I will definitely visit him. I think everything will be fine. At least he feels at home here; he spent a lot of time in that cave. It's much more convenient for me too, and I will do everything I can. Let us hope for a speedy recovery, since time moves faster here. I will try to find one person. He is a real specialist and will definitely help. And you did everything you could.
I hope so... Now all Fang can do is wait and hope.
Fang, what happened? And where did Doctor go?

You tripped the booby trap you told me to set myself. Forgot about it? You're lucky shrapnel did not tear you up, only stunned you. Doctor was here a long time ago. He left you a note somewhere around here, make sure you read it.
I read the note. Tell me, why did Doctor run off so fast? Or was I out for too long?
I'll read it. But answer me first: why did Doctor run off so fast? Or was I out for too long?

Not long, a couple of minutes maybe. I was about to come over to you, then I heard you moving. I got stunned a bit myself; I did not expect anyone to crawl in here. Doctor always comes in by teleporter, and nobody else ever comes here. Except you, you've been dropping by more often lately.\nDoctor's last visit was about two days ago. He said he brought me a "Compass." As I understand it, it can move you through the bubble to the cave under the lake in the Foggy Thicket. I know that cave, I used to have a spot set up there.
Wait. So Doctor was not here when I blacked out? I do not get it...

I am the one who does not get you... Did you just see Doctor here? Are you sure you were not concussed? Double vision, nausea? Hit your head when you fell? Concussions are tricky, you can start seeing things...
I am not sure... maybe I imagined it, you're right. So you are saying Doctor was here two days ago?

Well... It's hard to track time in this place, but around that. I told him I asked you to contact Sakharov so he could come up with some kind of protection. So he left me the artifact, and in case you came by again, a note for you. Doctor thinks if they can build protection for my brain, it should also help with teleport travel...\nAnd I completely forgot about the booby trap. I did not think about how you would crawl in here yourself, otherwise I would have told Doc to remove it.

So for some reason Doctor thinks it is better to move you to the Thicket, not to Sakharov? But he did not say that directly in the note. Strange. Maybe he just did not want to take responsibility if something goes wrong...
So for some reason Doctor thinks it is better to move you to the Thicket, not to Sakharov? I should probably read the note first.
I do not even know what to say... It is up to you, Marked One, what to do with all this. Just please do it soon, I have no strength left... How much longer do I have to rot in here?
Wait a bit, I need to think it all over again.
Fang, time to get you out of here.
Finally! What is your plan?
Sakharov gave me a special helmet. Says it will shield the radiation... And you will be able to move safely to the Foggy Thicket through the teleporter in the corner of the room.

Sakharov gave me a special helmet. Says it will shield the radiation... And you will be able to move safely to the Foggy Thicket through the teleporter in the corner of the room. So... where did I... Hold on, I must have dropped it.
I just hope the "Compass" Doctor left me is tuned right. I would hate to end up who knows where...

Do not sweat it, it will be fine. Here is the helmet, put it on. You said you have a set-up spot in the cave under the lake, you'll stay there for now. I think Doc will visit you soon. Maybe I will drop by too.

I'd like to believe that... Otherwise where am I supposed to go in the forest when I cannot see?! But in that cave I know every way in and out by touch. All right. Hope we meet again. You still remind me of someone. Your voice, the way you talk, your intonation. I wish I could see you with my own eyes... Take care.
Wait! I wanted to ask one more thing. What do you know about the Monolith? And what does it mean that "it's an illusion"? I... well, while I was out, I seemed to hear Doctor say that.

About the Monolith? There was a legend that it was a special artifact that grants wishes. I think Strelok believed it was not a legend and looked for a way to reach it. But I do not really know much about that. Seems Strelok and Ghost met some scientist and discussed it, but I do not know what came of it.\nOh, and one more thing I remembered: shortly before I got hit, Strelok asked me to think about how to crack the coded locks on bunker doors you sometimes find in the Zone. I did not dig into it then, no time, and he was in a hurry somewhere. He also asked me to find a decent computer. Said we would figure it out together and think how to make a decoder. He mentioned some labs too. I think he wanted to use them to make a quick push north, maybe to that Monolith...
I do not get it, how is that even possible? What labs?

I did not get him then either. Strelok and Ghost were always crazy, showing up out of nowhere and then vanishing on another raid. So anyway, one day Strelok barged in after another run saying, "This is our chance!" Looks like he found something. Later Ghost kept swearing that day they barely got away from the mercs. Then he questioned me, asked whether Strelok gave me anything, and if so what exactly... I told him Strelok gave me nothing useful, just instructions. So I do not know what labs he meant...
And what happened then?

Nothing. I went to the Valley on his errand, and on the way back I got hit... Find Ghost or that scientist they met, you'll learn more. I just cannot remember the scientist's name.\nWell, I should go. Stay healthy, friend!
Same to you.
Who is that? Doctor?
Fang! It's me, Marked One. Glad you're alive. How are you?
Could be better... Good thing at least you stopped by. Doctor has not shown up for some reason. I keep wondering, maybe we were wrong to refuse help from the scientists?
The scientists are not going anywhere. If needed, we'll contact them too. And Doctor will come, no doubt. Wait.
Fine, he comes, then what? He'll take me to the hut?

Not yet... You see, the helmet probably won't work here, in the Thicket. It already did its job, it protected you during teleportation. But we'll come up with something, we have to. The main thing is you are alive, you can talk... and all that.
Some life... Still, better than a coffin, no arguing with that.
Keep your hope up, we will find a solution.
That's all I can do. Thanks, Marked One. Come by, do not forget me.
I will come again, of course.
Who is that? Doctor?
No. It's me, Marked One. How are you holding up here?
I'm fine. Just sitting here...
Fang, I remembered something...
Yeah? Well, congratulations. What did you remember?
Voices. They sounded distant, like through cotton. As if the one hearing them was concussed or... barely conscious. There were two people talking. One of them called the other "Fang."
Oh really? And what were those "voices" saying?

One of them was urging Fang not to leave some third person behind. The other argued an emission was coming and they would not make it with that burden. I think they were talking about me, and by the feel of it, it happened here, in the Foggy Thicket. Can you tell me about that incident, if it really happened and was not just a dream or a hallucination?
Hmm... there was something like that once, but I do not think that guy we carried was you. Then again, how else would that memory surface for you...
Tell it from the beginning, and we'll sort it out.

All right. Just keep in mind my own head is still foggy, so I might easily mix up events or details.\nAnyway, for a while Strelok got into running experiments in the Foggy Thicket. First he asked me to find a place here for a camp. I found a roomy cave, and he set it up like a workshop with a storage room. I hauled all kinds of parts there for him, and I made some things myself from his blueprints. There was all kinds of stuff there... As for why he needed any of it, hell if I know.\nSo, about that incident... It happened near the "dead Monolith." That is what Strelok called a big rock not far from the hut...

To be honest, I am not fully convinced it was you. I do not know where that memory came from. Maybe the Zone wind brought you scraps of someone else's memory?! I cannot see you, but you understand... that stalker was almost a corpse, or like a twisted zombie.
I am about to break my own brain trying to figure this out. Still, some things got clearer either way. Thanks.
Listen, Fang, I need a serious talk with you.
Serious? So everything really was for nothing... no helping me now, right?

No, I mean something else. I met Ghost, and he told me... I do not even know what. Like Ivar brought me to Strelok, like Doctor knew a lot about me from the very beginning. And that Strelok needed me... as some kind of test subject. Is that true?

I know almost nothing about Ivar, and even less about his dealings with Strelok. Strelok was always playing his own game, I told you that already. He shared plans only when he needed you to know. Even then, he could hold things back or feed half-truths. Otherwise you could not squeeze an extra word out of him.
Fine. Then what about me?
How would I know what was with you... We first met in the underground under Agroprom, remember?
But even then you said my voice reminded you of someone...
I did. When you cannot see, your mind paints all sorts of things. You keep hoping it is someone familiar talking to you, some friend. Someone who will help.
I know in broad strokes that Strelok ran experiments here in the Thicket. Can you tell me any details?

I found a roomy cave here once, and Strelok set it up like a workshop with a storage room. I hauled all kinds of parts there for him, and I made some things myself from his blueprints. There was all kinds of stuff there... Why he needed it, hell if I know.\nAh! I remember one incident... It happened near the "dead Monolith." That is what Strelok called a big rock not far from the hut...
We already talked about this. About your "memory" and that guy, maybe hit by radiation, maybe something else...
Well? What happened there?

No, that man was definitely me. If you compare everything Doctor and others told me... yes, it all fits. The only thing unclear is whether Strelok did something to me there on purpose or not. And why he told no one his plans about me. No one, not even his closest comrades. I do not understand...

Another experiment was planned, but one of the blocks shorted out and burned the battery. Happens all the time in the Thicket. So I ran for a spare. When I came back, Strelok was arguing with Ghost about something, and next to them was the body of some man, looked like a stalker...
Hey, Marked One! You still here? Are you talking to me or thinking out loud?
Who was that and where did he come from? Did they explain anything at all?

What? Yeah, sorry... thinking out loud. All right, let's set that aside for now. Listen, Doctor told me Strelok wanted to reach the Monolith to destroy it. Seems he ran experiments here specifically to test whether that was possible. Do you happen to know if he made any progress?

Progress? Hardly. Strelok ordered us to haul that body to Doctor's hut immediately. And an emission was building, no time for talk. I do not even know why Strelok fussed over him so much... The guy looked like a corpse. Barely alive, he would not have survived the emission anyway...

Destroy the Monolith? Is that some kind of joke? Even if it really exists, how do you imagine doing that? Strelok spent so much time near the "dead Monolith," tinkering with something, blasting it with strange equipment, even shooting at it with some odd gun, like in sci-fi movies. Where did he even get that?! Some secret tech or what? And nothing. The rock is still standing. And you're talking about destroying the Monolith...
But you did carry him to Doctor, right?
A movie-style gun, huh? Interesting. I think I have seen something like that before.

We carried him to the hut, yes. Strelok immediately rushed off on his own business, told us to watch the stalker, and we stayed to wait out the emission. Doc examined the poor bastard, injected something, waved some strange artifact over his head... I got the impression he'd been hit by psi-radiation or something like that. Then after the emission ended, Doc said we had to move the man to the shelter under Agroprom. Supposedly you recover from psi-shocks better closer to the perimeter.

I remember someone saying the fanatics in Pripyat also have some kind of superweapon. Could that be where this came from? I would not be surprised if Strelok found a way in with them and they traded him that "blaster" for... I do not know, some rare artifact maybe?!
So I owe my life to you and Ghost. First you carried me to Doctor, then to Agroprom...
Last question. Did Strelok or Ghost ever talk in front of you about the "Black Mark," transferring consciousness, a psychomatrix, or anything like that?
What? No... I doubt it was you. I cannot see you, but that stalker was almost a corpse, you understand, like a twisted zombie.
You say strange things, Marked One. First the Monolith, now some matrix. I know nothing about that, and nobody talked about anything like it in front of me.
And still. I almost have no doubts left. Dig into your memory again: Strelok definitely never said why he might need me? Maybe even a hint...
All right, Fang, take care. Or maybe goodbye. I am not sure we'll meet again...
Nope. The only thing I figured out is this stalker... or you... anyway, he mattered to Strelok for some reason, and alive. Ghost kept breaking his head over that too.
Good luck, friend. So, have they finally decided what is going to happen with me?
Everything will be fine. Doctor will figure out how to help you. And Ivar, I hope, will drop by soon. Two heads are better than one.
I wanted to ask you something. They told me at the Bar you made some unusual weapon.
I made all kinds of things. Weapons too. Tuned one guy's TOZ, another guy's Kalash, you cannot remember it all.
This was a special weapon. A prototype, some kind of demo model.

Ah, that one, yes. I never finished it though. I worked from Strelok's blueprints. Where he even got them... I told him it would never fire. Where was I supposed to find that kind of charge? And he told me: do not worry, charge is not your problem, just build the hardware itself. So I did my best.
Did you try firing it?

I did. Strelok brought a pair of strange batteries for testing. Said he could not get more yet, he was missing some special substance. I thought he was joking, messing with me. I loaded it, aimed at a rock, and boom, the rock shattered. Shrapnel almost hit me in the head. I told him he could have warned me, I would have stood farther away. He scratched his head and said there was a calculation error. Needed a little redesign, he said.
Redesign what, the battery?
No, the hardware itself, focus the beam more.
Did you redesign it?
Yep. But I did not test it again. Thought to hell with it, let him shoot it himself. Maybe he miscalculated again, and this time I'd lose an arm.
So where is that weapon now?
What weapon? It is just another Strelok experiment. You were right: a prototype.
Prototype or not. Where is it?
With me. I left it in this cave for the time being. Just before you came, I happened to run into it. Need it? Take it.
Excellent! Thanks, Fang.
Better tell me how much longer I have to sit here.
Not much longer...
I decided to come check on you. We might not see each other again...
I was happy at first... What are you up to? Doctor came by, said you decided to push all the way to the very center.

I was there already, at the center's edge. But only at the edge... I still was not allowed to reach the main thing. Just do not ask who stopped me or what that "main thing" even is. I do not know, but I want to understand. You cannot solve this head-on. That's how it is.\nSo what about Doctor, did he do anything?

Yeah... you are one stubborn bastard, Marked One. And Doctor... no, he has done nothing yet. Feels like he has no ideas. But Ivar stopped by, you know, that same one. Turns out he is the top specialist in the Zone on zombies.
And what did Ivar say?
Nothing specific. Just gave me hope. Asked what I remember and what I do not. Asked about Strelok too.
What did he want with Strelok?

Bad wording. Not Strelok himself, his experiments. We talked about them too. After our last meeting I tried to squeeze something else useful out of my memory, and one conversation with Ghost surfaced.
About what?

About the "Black Mark." You mentioned it before, but it did not trigger anything in my head then. Later, when I really strained my brain, the memory surfaced.\nGhost once asked if I knew anyone with the "Black Mark." I asked why. He said Strelok needed either a carrier of it or the mark itself. Could not find one, it was driving him crazy. One day the network was full of requests to help get rid of it, then suddenly silence for weeks. So one thing led to another, and Ghost said if Strelok could not find it, then he needed a live Monolith member.
How? Were you planning a raid on Pripyat, or where were you going to catch them?

Hold on, I was not done. Just any Monolith member would not do. He needed someone who had not completely lost touch with their human side, not fully submitted to another will. I said: and where do you find one like that? Ask everyone, "Hey pal, you are not a Monolith guy by chance, are you? Planning to become one?" I did not get him. What kind of joke was that...
And he?

He said he did not understand it himself, but Strelok needed exactly that kind. Seems Strelok had some idea about it, but as usual he was in no hurry to share. Ghost tried more than once to start that conversation, and Strelok brushed him off: "I was just thinking out loud, do not worry about it..." Ghost got nothing out of him. I think Strelok did not really let Ghost into his business. Or maybe something happened between them and he stopped telling him everything.
That Ghost is quite a character... So you trusted him completely?

Who can you trust completely in the Zone? Fate threw us together, we handled different business. We told each other what we thought was necessary, but... I held some things back, and he did too. We both understood that. We just did not dig into it. We worked well together, that was enough.
All right, then why did this topic interest Ivar?

I do not know. I told him everything I told you, plus this episode about the Mark. I think it gave Ivar some important idea. I heard his breathing speed up, he got agitated, started packing for the road right away.
What do you think rattled him so much?

I told you, I do not know. He only muttered that he urgently needed to dig up his old materials and notes on the "effect of fragments" of something on something. Dropped a couple more unclear phrases, like he was talking to himself, then said goodbye and left.
You think he went outside the Zone for those "old materials"?
Even if he did, fine. As long as he can help me become a normal person again. I have no strength left. He is my last hope.
He is a smart man. If he latched onto an idea, I am sure your forced "confinement" here will end soon. Until then, wait and hope, Fang, wait and hope. Farewell.
How is Fang? How is he doing?
Still unclear. Nothing definite. Ivar came by, and I explained how to reach the cave where Fang is staying.
So Ivar has fully recovered now? Is he still somewhere here in the Thicket?
I do not know where he is. He looked pretty lively already. As I understand it, he is going to assemble another group of "seekers." Hardly anyone from his old group survived...
I see. I probably will not catch him at the Bar now. Then I should visit Fang while I am here.
(!) Reminders
General
Personal Notes
Who am I?

Maybe a dream, maybe reality... Some vehicle... a long ride, then darkness, but what was before that? And did any of it really happen, or is it just a nightmare? I cannot make sense of it... pure delirium... Now Sidorovich, the local trader, decided to call me Marked One. It all feels like a bad dream. \n \nOnly I cannot wake up. What do I do? Where do I go? Worse yet, who am I? First thing to understand is that for now I'll have to run errands for this Sidorovich. He says he saved my life, after all... And maybe things are not that bad, I'll look around, pull myself together, maybe my head clears up.
First Impressions

Well, well, well... Got some fresh air, saw the local critters... tried the local "attraction" called anomalies... Judging by the fact that I survived at all, I have dealt with the Zone and its quirks before, but my head stubbornly refuses to remember who I am. 
 
Sidorovich, the sly old fox, realized he can use me almost for free now, and he wants to do exactly that. Maybe that is why on the Cordon he asked Doctor to patch me up? Why else does he need a "dead man"? And now I am apparently his eternal debtor, in simple words, his eternal slave. No way. Not forever. Sure, at first I will not refuse his errands. He can help with gear, for example. And he keeps hinting about that damned Strelok, at least giving me a direction for where to start. For now, Strelok is my only thread to the past. If he is connected at all, since Sidorovich says I kept repeating the name "Strelok" in delirium. You can see anything in delirium. But I did keep repeating it for a reason... 
 
Anyway, I need to move north. Sitting on the Cordon, I am not going to remember anything. We'll see what comes next...
First Dangerous Foray

Sidorovich asked me to look into some documents. That means a serious run through the Zone, to the former Agroprom Research Institute. Fine, I am ready to cooperate. I will find something and make it clear to Sidorovich that after that, we are square for all his "kindness and care." I am not working for him for free after this. If he wants something, he pays. 
 
Along with the task, I heard trader gossip that sounds more like a legend, about some area to the north on the way to the Zone center where your "brain starts boiling." Considering my head is clearly not right, I should look into that and ask around. Who knows, maybe I was there too... 
 
Also, the trader assumes Strelok somehow learned to pass through that area (or maybe he is lying just to give me a reason to go there). He says the traders want to know how. Why they want it is obvious, they want access to untouched artifact fields. Their potential Klondike does not interest me much, but information about Strelok... that is worth trying for.
Meeting Mole

Met Mole at Agroprom. Just a meeting, nothing special. I do not remember him, he does not know me. But Mole told me about some Strelok stash in the Agroprom underground. Maybe a story, maybe not, but that stash talk did not come from nowhere. Looks like I should go down there and search it myself. Who knows, maybe I will remember something. 
 
But the most interesting part was not that. He said there is some strange gas in the tunnels, or suffocation, or God knows what. And you should not go into places like that without a suit with a mask or a gas mask. I have a feeling I already knew that... or suspected it. From where? From whom?.. 
 
Anyway, I have to try. No idea what waits for me there. Hope that stash reveals something, if it even exists...
Strelok's Stash

I made it into "Strelok's stash" after all. I do not even know what sixth sense told me how to get in. Maybe intuition, maybe memory kicked in. But by all logic I should not know that. It is not even Strelok's personal stash, it is a secret place for a whole group, and I definitely was not part of it. And in that stash I met one of that group's members, Fang. 
 
Fang is in pretty bad shape, and he gave little information, but enough to understand this: besides Strelok himself, there were two more in his group, Ghost and Fang. According to Fang, Ghost and Strelok tried to reach the very center of the Zone. Why, and most importantly how? 
 
So for now we have one name of someone who might know where to find Strelok: Ghost. Because Fang was badly hurt, is stuck underground, and does not really know much. There is also some scientist, a mutual acquaintance of theirs, but that is still too little to go on. As for Strelok, it looks like we really do need to search the northern regions of the Zone. 
 
And one last thing: Doctor. He met Strelok, he knows this secret place, and he visits Fang, so he knew him before. Should I assume Doctor was in Strelok's group too? I need to find that out when I meet him. 
 
And I should try to help Fang himself. Right now he is blind, and his head is not in good shape (just like mine). But if Fang recovers and starts remembering specifics, I definitely need to talk to him, which means I have to contact the scientists at Yantar.
Barkeep's Task

I spoke with Barkeep at Sidorovich's request. From the papers I brought for that old swindler, the traders guessed that there is a classified underground lab in the so-called Dark Valley, designated X-18. Barkeep offered me a trip there to search for information and documents. Says I should talk to Borov, the leader of a bandit group, urges caution, and... he is clearly not telling me everything about that dungeon. 
 
 I am not exactly thrilled about meeting bandits, much less crawling into some underground hellhole. On the other hand, why not establish contact with these guys. My encounters with lowlifes at the Garbage were not pleasant, but maybe with contacts I get some kind of "roof," and armed idiots will stop getting in the way of my search. Right now, my search and information matter more than anyone's turf wars.
 
And that is the key thing in Barkeep's request: he is hinting about a path north and "showing concern" for my search for Strelok. Sure, he is hooking me, obvious enough, wants to send the one who "needs it most." But who knows what he knows and what he might tell me if I do what he asks. 
 
As for the safe way north, where Strelok might be now, Barkeep somehow connects it to X-18 and to information that can be dug up in that lab. If it is all connected, I will pay Borov a visit. First, I am not signing anything and making no promises. Second, it would help to learn Dark Valley and its inhabitants better. And build contacts. Good relations always help you get information.
Lab X-18

Yeah... Lab X-18 and its current inhabitants are no cheerful place. I never thought filth like that could exist. What surprised me is the entrance has been blocked for ages, yet those creatures live there just fine. What do they even eat, and where did they come from? There were bodies of some scientists too. Sure, skeletons in suits, been there a long time, but why did the monsters not tear them apart? Or were the monsters full, and those people got there recently? Then how did they get in? I do not understand. It just does not add up... 
 
I found some documents... Did not understand much from those either. Looks like technical specs for some blocks for Kaimanov emitters. But here is the interesting part: those blocks were meant for another lab, code X-16, also classified. And in one big room I saw some kind of bubble. I should ask someone smart what that is... 
 
Well, I found what I found. Hope it is enough for Barkeep to figure out the route north. Though skimming the documents, I saw no hints about that, except mention of some emitter that seems to be somewhere in the north. Whether it is connected to Kaimanov's emitter is unclear. Let Barkeep sort that out.
Is the "Brain Scorcher" Man-Made?

Barkeep (or more likely one of his tame eggheads) dug up something from the X-18 documents. He talked about the "Brain Scorcher," which I have already heard about here and there. He thinks the emission that blocks the path north is connected to Lab X-16, located near the scientists' camp at Yantar. They are studying something there that resembles the Scorcher's effect. 
 
All that is great, who is studying what and where, but Barkeep seems to think he has me saddled through my interest in Strelok and now plans to drive me all the way to the "Scorcher." As far as I can tell, traders have not just now become interested in the path north, but there are not many people willing to look for it, if Barkeep is dumping it on me despite all the people at the Bar, now and before I showed up... Or maybe those he sent do not come back. And here he has a "fool" who remembers nothing anyway... 
 
And that is where my real interest begins. If someone turned this "Scorcher" on, or keeps it on, why? And what exactly does it "scorch"? And whose brain... What about my memory? Was mine scorched too? Have I been there already? Questions, nothing but questions, and only scientists might answer at least some of them. Only they might know what this "Scorcher" is and why. So whether I like it or not, my road now leads to the Zone's scientist crowd, to Yantar.
One Step From Ghost

So I am almost one step away from one of Strelok's people. Ghost and a pair of eggheads went down into Lab X-16. One problem: I am unlikely to find him alive. And even if he survived, I probably will not find him there anyway, because getting into that lab is not simple at all, it may take time, maybe a lot of time, to figure out how to get in. 
 
Sakharov named the hours when the emission drops and we can try to find the entrance to that underground site. But he does not know where that entrance is. Wandering around hoping to find it by luck is stupid. I need precise information, because I will have to move fast so the emission does not fry me and turn my brain to mush. 
 
At the very least, Ghost's traces (or maybe what is left of him) should be in X-16. There are no other leads yet. I can also look for papers Barkeep wants while I am there (if they are there). And on the way I need to pull some switches and levers, scientists want me, if I get inside, to try doing something with the emission source. Then they can study everything on site. If I run into switches, why not try. If I manage to shut something down, I can study this lab and nearby areas more carefully. Maybe I will find something that leads to Ghost, or even Strelok himself. Right now the main thing is to find out the entrance for sure.
Helping Fang

I finally got a device from Sakharov, more precisely a helmet, which he says can help Fang reach the surface. Sounds good, but I have doubts. 
 
First, Sakharov's odd wording. He clearly does not see Fang as a full human being. Then why did he get interested in him right away? Why Fang? Just one more unknown stalker, and there are already plenty wandering around his bunker. But Sakharov immediately latched onto the idea of extracting Fang specifically and... taking him somewhere. 
 
And that is the second issue. Where, and why? And why do I have to stay out of sight while this happens? So no one sees me... or so I do not see something? Not clear... 
 
On the other hand, Fang needs help. Right now he is the only one who could tell me anything about Strelok and Ghost. If they take him somewhere, maybe he will get help there, you cannot really treat him in the Zone. But then I probably will not see him again or talk to him, about Strelok or anything else. If I try to move him somewhere else with this helmet instead of Sakharov's helicopter, there is no guarantee that helps him and does not drive him underground again to sit without help, just in a different place. But then I could still talk to him... and maybe he would get better there and remember something. I have doubts...
Traces of Strelok in the Swamps

Searched all over the Swamps... In a drift near Tuzla I found scattered fragments of information. Nothing substantial, just correspondence, equipment orders, incident reports. The name Lebedev comes up, one of the leaders of the Clear Sky group. If only I knew where he is... 
 
Most likely these are remnants of the papers passed to Ghost. Either these scraps were the least important and he took the rest, or, more likely, they are just pieces of what did not burn. Ghost probably would not bother hauling waste paper, he read it all and burned it, and this part remained. 
 
Of everything I read, only mentions of teleporters and scientist interest in them seem important. Fang said Strelok "teleported" to the Swamps. From where? Could this have been some special teleporter, the same one a "Yakovlev group" was looking for? I should ask the scientists about that. There is also mention of mysterious disappearances, scientists vanished. Are those the same scientists who wanted to study a "space-time anomaly," or is this about something else? Maybe Strelok came by teleporter and left the same way. Or vanished like those scientists... Again a pile of useless questions. In any case, all this happened long ago, and for now this lead is a dead end, but I should remember it. I found neither Ghost nor any traces of him or Strelok in the Swamps, nor anything left of Clear Sky.
A Strange Dream

I do not understand what I did. I pulled a lever and... blacked out. Probably the strain of the past few days. While I was out, I had a dream... 
 
A photograph. A gray-haired man is holding it, and a huge dog spins at his feet. The man looks into the distance, but all around is swamp, and the landscape is nothing like in the photo. In the fog you can barely make out a figure walking away. The man mutters as if talking to himself: "If it's so important, then why did you never properly explain what this place is, and where you got this photograph..." Then... I see, from the side, a young smiling guy on the threshold of a hut, cheerfully saying: "If only you knew where I managed to go, and what I saw there!"... and so on. 
 
In short, nonsense. The gray-haired man is Doctor, that is how I took him in the dream, probably because Doctor was the first person I saw when I woke up on the Cordon. But who was the second one? I understand these are associations, a dream is just a dream. But... it all felt too real. Which raises questions. Is the second man me? Or who? Or is it Strelok, whose name they say I kept repeating in delirium. 
 
Why am I even writing down nonsense like this as if it matters? It feels important. And most important is that photograph of something that can exist only at the very center of the Zone. And that "Doctor-like" question, how did you take that photo? How could you take it at all? Nobody can get in there. Barkeep and the rest who keep pushing me only want to find a way there, to the center. It is like something from another time... Or maybe just a dream, fatigue from the past days and thoughts twisting themselves into strange shapes. I do not know what to think. But it all felt too real, even in a dream. 
 
At least Barkeep can calm down. I did find some papers, which means I did my job. Let him sort them out, he will probably be satisfied with that. For me, the main thing from that trip is I found at least a tiny lead: some Guide on the Cordon. He has some photo with Strelok.
"Brain Scorcher"

As expected, nothing is simple. The X-16 documents gave little. Barkeep says there was mention that the bunker entrance is coded. But of course he knows neither exactly where the entrance is nor the door code. 
 
First, I need to find out how to break through there at all. Second, I need to find the entrance itself. Third, I need a way to get inside, either learn the code somewhere or find a working decoder. And lastly, but important: if the documents I already found are so vague, where does Barkeep get his certainty that the underground lab bunker contains the antenna control point for the "Brain Scorcher"? He only thinks so, with no guarantees. He just sees I want to move forward and plays on that, and whether I come back is of little concern to him. In that case the question is: am I ready to go to the "Scorcher"? Do I really need this? 
 
All right, I can look for a decoder, that does not commit me to anything and might be useful somewhere. Fine, I can also talk to Sakharov, a scientist could provide useful information. I can even try going to Radar and looking around. Maybe I will find some leads there. Then we'll see what the situation dictates...
Doctor's Note

I hit a booby trap in Strelok's stash, the same trap I myself had advised Fang to set. Stupid. 
 
I do not even know why I crawled back into that hole again. Guide on the Cordon said Doctor might be here, and I hoped to meet him and learn more about Strelok. From what Fang said, Doctor could have been part of Strelok's group. Doctor himself said on the Cordon that this is exactly why I interested him, I kept repeating Strelok's name in delirium even though, by his calculations, I could not have met Strelok at all. But I never found Doctor. 
 
None of this would be worth writing down if not for one strange incident. I blacked out and in some dream or delirium I saw Doctor. Very clearly, as if he was right there speaking to me. But he spoke to me either as if I were Strelok, or as if I were his son... And he said strange things. Something about the Monolith being an illusion, about how I had always tried to understand something... always? understand what? Where does this come from? I only saw Doctor briefly a couple of times on the Cordon. 
 
Still, it was some kind of dream. Another "waking dream," like in those labs. Why does this keep happening to me? It feels like every time I try to understand something, every time it feels like I have grabbed a lead, some force blocks me, shuts down my mind, and puts me to sleep. Or tries to plant something in my dreams... I do not understand. Maybe I am making things up just to explain what is happening somehow. 
 
But Doctor really was there and left a message. For me. He has some business or trouble, has to lie low and stay out of sight for a while. He has a safe place in the Foggy Thicket, and I definitely need to meet him and talk.
Barrier

So I have reached the very edge of the inhabited Zone. Beyond it is unknown. Though... it is clear enough what can be there: monsters, anomalies, uncertainty, and death at every step. 
 
But plain death may even be the better option. From beyond the Barrier come not only waves of mutants, but sometimes zombies too, bodies without souls. Who are they? Former stalkers chasing rich loot, or Monolith castoffs? Or maybe they are Monolith members themselves, the ones rumored to be somewhere around Radar and beyond? Too many unclear questions. But the main one is: what keeps drawing everyone there? If so many are coming out of there, how many are still left there... Why are stalkers so eager to go there, knowing the dangers and seeing the outcome of those attempts, zombies? Everyone is pulled north like by a magnet. Do they really believe that strongly in the Monolith legend and wish-granting? Or... is it something else. 
 
Think all you want, I am going there too. I explain it to myself however I can, "find myself, find out who I am, find Strelok," but they also had their own explanations. They all went there under different pretexts, thinking they were going by their own will, knowing where and why, not being pulled by something beyond their will. 
 
I wonder if anyone ever reached that Monolith at all. Maybe those are the ones who found happiness there. Happy brainless idiots... Nothing to think about, regret, worry, care for, just walk around, grunt, and drool with a happy smile. 
 
Maybe it is self-deception, but I would rather think I am the one choosing to go there for an important and serious reason. And that I will not end up like them... At least that gives me some goal and some hope that I will learn what I want there.
Radar

A very hostile place... You rarely meet stalkers here now. Maybe people once came here hoping to find their Klondike of artifacts, but over time the number of daredevils dropped sharply. Those who pushed through seem to have joined the zombie ranks, who now make up most of Radar's population. Not counting Monolith members... 
 
Though these "Monolith members" are not much like the ones veterans talk about. They are more like stalkers on the edge. They cannot go farther, and no longer have the strength to leave. Something keeps them... Maybe they are future zombies? Maybe a person does not become a zombie at once, maybe it is gradual: first speech gets bad, then they rock their heads by the fire, then it's just "kiiill." Who knows... Then what are real Monolith members like? Better not know, probably... 
 
This area is called Radar because of some strange antennas emitting some strange field. But here's the question: those antennas and transmission systems were clearly built by people, before the disaster. Someone built them on purpose. And whatever those antennas emitted back then, whatever they were built for, they did not decide to run by themselves. People switched them on knowing they would emit... So why does nobody now know what that emission is? Why did the professor have to calculate downtimes and come up with some suit... Does that mean the emission is no longer what it used to be? Someone retuned it, altered it... Unclear. 
 
Anyway. Let the smart heads think about that. If the professor says it can be turned off, then it should be turned off, and what difference does it make what it used to emit. And if it can be turned off, we can push farther north... Though I am no longer sure myself what I expect to find there. But turning back now is not an option...
Antenna Control Point

I managed to push through to the control point on Radar. What was I even thinking!? I expected difficulties, sure, but if I had known in advance what I would face, I never would have gotten into this adventure. But time was pushing me, and I kept thinking, just a bit more, a few more meters, around that turn, and if it fails I will turn back... And of course I miscalculated. Already on the antenna grounds I clearly understood I would not make it back, the emission was about to rise again, and my only option was to go down into that bunker and look for an exit by luck. Inside the bunker it was no better than on the surface. But there was no way out and no route for retreat... 
 
The bunker itself did not impress me. I expected control panels, monitors, installations, red buttons, all the stuff to run such a complex, and instead I found wreckage and abandonment. Felt like everything had been evacuated in a hurry, and whatever was left got looted. I did find some working equipment. Flipped some switches from one position to another. Something turned on or off, I have no idea. No time to think, I had to get out, or I'd be stuck like that unlucky nerd whose exit code I found by pure chance. How did he even get in there? I need to ask Sakharov about him. 
 
There was a surprise on the way out. Maybe from the extreme stress of the run, maybe from sheer exhaustion, I fell asleep. No idea how long I was out. Judging by the watch, around two weeks, though it could have glitched. Why these strange coincidences? Every lab means some kind of blackout... But the main thing, I survived and got out. That's the miracle. Tell anyone and they will not believe it. Better not tell them anyway. They'll just say I am an idiot for going, and that all this is a lie. Hell, I barely believe I did it myself...
Ivar

Turns out my whole heroic trip into the labs under Radar was for nothing. Whatever I switched on or off there does not matter. Ivar and his people did everything elsewhere. Yes, that same Ivar I have heard so much about. How they pulled it off, he still cannot explain clearly. The emission damaged his health, and all that is left is to hope for his body's strength, for a miracle, or for Doctor. \n \nIvar, it turns out, is some kind of medic, maybe even a scientist, and he worked with psychos, as Barkeep said. But most important, he knew Strelok himself! Were those his notes on the flash drive I found in the Agroprom underground? If so, he is now my first real thread in these so-far fruitless attempts to trace Strelok.
Monolith

Does some Monolith really exist, or is it a myth, an invented deity? In any case, those called Monolith members believe in it, worship it, speak of it with reverence... But who are they themselves? Psychos, half-zombies maybe. On Radar they mumbled nonsense, and their leader, who could still talk a little, said they no longer need language, that they communicate mentally somehow. Think what you like: maybe they really are "enlightened," or maybe they can no longer separate reality from whatever is in their heads, just talking to their own hallucinations. 
 
But to hell with it, everyone goes mad in their own way. What interests me is why this is not the first time they almost treat me as one of their own. What did they mean by "blocking"? Where am I supposed to go, or can go, and why do they need that? What is supposed to call me, and to where? They speak in such a way that you can only guess what they mean. Maybe they think one thing and say another, because they cannot express it clearly. So they pick whatever words they have not forgotten yet. And by "blocking" or my "calling" I might be understanding something different from what they meant. 
 
Only one thing is clear so far. They need some "seeds," artifacts, planted, and supposedly that will let me pass where no human goes. Maybe to that same Monolith... Their Connector will tell me after I do what they ask. Fine, we'll see. I do not even know myself what is better now, so let it unfold on its own. Tossing artifacts into anomalies is no big deal. If it calls, it calls, and maybe it really will tell me how to reach the very center of the Zone. If not... I will not be too upset.
